      17             : // This is a hack to pass the number of CUDA loop iteration count around
      18             : // When translating "omp target" , we need to calculate the number of thread blocks needed.
      19             : // To do that, we need to know how many CUDA threads are needed.
      20             : // We think the number of CUDA threads is the iteration count of the parallelized CUDA loop (peeled off), assuming increment is always 1
      21             : //TODO  Also, the incremental value should be irrevelvant?
      22             : // The loop will be transformed away when we call transOmpTargtLoop since we use bottom-up translation
      23             : // So the loop iteration count needs to be stored globally before transOmpTarget() is called.
      24             : static SgExpression* cuda_loop_iter_count_1 = NULL;
      25             : 
      26             : // this is another hack to pass the reduction variables for accelerator model directives
      27             : // We use bottom-up translation for AST with both omp parallel and omp for.
      28             : // reduction is implemented using a two level reduction method: inner thread block level + beyond block level
      29             : // We save the per-block variable and its reduction type integer into a map when generating inner block level reduction.
      30             : // We use the map to help generate beyond block level reduction
      31             : static std::map<SgVariableSymbol* , int> per_block_reduction_map;

     108             :   /** Algorithm for patchUpSharedVariables edited by Hongyi Ma on August 7th 2012
     109             :    *   1. find all variables references in  parallel region
     110             :    *   2. find all variable declarations in this parallel region
     111             :    *   3. check whether these variables has been in private or shared clause already
     112             :    *   4. if not, add them into shared clause
     113             :    */

     330             :   //! Return the data sharing attribute type of a variable within a context node (anchor_stmt indicates the start search location within AST)
     331             :   //! Possible values include: e_shared, e_private,  e_firstprivate,  e_lastprivate,  e_reduction, e_threadprivate, e_copyin, and e_copyprivate.
     332             :   // The rules are defined in OpenMP 4.5 specification,  page 179,
     333             :   //    2.15.1 Data-sharing Attribute Rules
     334           0 :   omp_construct_enum getDataSharingAttribute (SgSymbol* sym, SgNode* anchor_node)
     335             :   {
     336           0 :     omp_construct_enum rt_val = e_shared; // shared by default for now
     337             :     //TODO: if default() is present, we have to change this.
     338           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (sym != NULL);
     339           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (anchor_node!= NULL);
     340           0 :     SgStatement* anchor_stmt = getEnclosingStatement (anchor_node);
     341           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (anchor_stmt != NULL);
     342             : 
     343           0 :     SgVariableSymbol * var_sym = isSgVariableSymbol (sym);
     344           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (var_sym!= NULL);
     345             : 
     346           0 :     SgInitializedName* iname = isSgInitializedName( var_sym->get_declaration() );
     347             :     //TODO: what to do with SgOmpWorkshareStatement ?  it is a region/SgUpirBodyStatement, but it does not belong to UpirFieldBodyStatement
     348             : 
     349             :     // obtain the enclosing OpenMP clause body statement: SgUpirWorksharingStatement, parallel, sections, single, target, target data, task, etc.
     350             :     // TODO: this may not be reliable:  region {stmtlist ;  loop; stmtlist; }
     351           0 :     SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* omp_clause_body_stmt = findEnclosingUpirFieldBodyStatement (anchor_stmt);
     352             : 
     353           0 :     if (omp_clause_body_stmt != NULL)
     354             :     {
     355           0 :       omp_construct_enum temp_val = getExplicitDataSharingAttribute (iname, omp_clause_body_stmt);
     356             :       // We assume the input code is correct. So all predetermined variables listed in clauses are conforming to the spec.
     357           0 :       if (temp_val != e_unknown)
     358             :       {
     359           0 :         rt_val = temp_val ;
     360             :         return rt_val;  // use direct return to avoid messy if-else logic
     361             :       }
     362             :       // not explicitly specified, using the rules for predetermined and implicitly determined
     363             :       else
     364             :       {
     365             :         //Not in explicit data-sharing attribute clause at this level,
     366             : 
     367             :         // Apply implicit rules :
     368             :         // check if it is locally declared  (the declaration is inside of the omp_clause_body_stmt )
     369           0 :         SgVariableDeclaration* var_decl = isSgVariableDeclaration(iname->get_declaration());
     370             :          // ROSE_ASSERT (var_decl != NULL);
     371             :          // it could also be SgFunctionParameterList or other declarations
     372             :          // if declared at function parameters, the scope is outside, it should be shared by default if no other rules apply.
     373           0 :         if (var_decl && isAncestor (omp_clause_body_stmt, var_decl))
     374             :         {
     375             :           // declared in a scope inside the construct:
     376             :           // Variables with automatic storage duration are private
     377             :           // Variables with static storage duration are shared.
     378           0 :           if (isStatic (var_decl))
     379             :             rt_val = e_shared;
     380             :           else
     381           0 :             rt_val = e_private;
     382           0 :           return rt_val;
     383             :         }
     384             : 
     385           0 :         if (isThreadprivate (sym))
     386             :     // Variables appearing in threadprivate directives are threadprivate.
     387             :         {
     388           0 :           rt_val = e_threadprivate;
     389             :           return rt_val;
     390             :         }
     391             : 
     392             :         // Check if a SgInitializedName is used as a loop index within a AST subtree.
     393             :         // This function will use a bottom-up traverse starting from the subtree_root to find
     394             :         // all enclosing loops and check if ivar is used as an index for either of them.
     395             : //        if (isLoopIndexVariable (iname, anchor_stmt)) // TODO: need more work here
     396             :         //  not just any loop variables, but these affected by the OpenMP directives
     397           0 :         if (isAffectedForLoopIndexVariable ( omp_clause_body_stmt, iname ))
     398             :         {
     399             :           /*  loop iteration variable
     400             :             private: The loop iteration variable(s) in the associated for-loop(s) of a for, parallel for,
     401             :             taskloop, or distribute construct.
     402             : 
     403             :             linear: The loop iteration variable in the associated for-loop of a simd construct with just one
     404             :             associated for-loop is linear with a linear-step that is the increment of the associated for-loop.
     405             : 
     406             :             lastprivate: The loop iteration variables in the associated for-loops of a simd construct with multiple
     407             :             associated for-loops are lastprivate.
     408             :           */
     409           0 :           SgUpirLoopStatement* upir_loop = isSgUpirLoopStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt);
     410           0 :           if (upir_loop != NULL && ((SgUpirLoopParallelStatement*)(upir_loop->get_upir_parent()))->get_worksharing())
     411             :           // TODO: check other types of constructs here: taskloop, distribute construct
     412             :           {
     413           0 :             rt_val = e_private;
     414             :             return rt_val;
     415             :           }
     416           0 :           else if (upir_loop != NULL && ((SgUpirLoopParallelStatement*)(upir_loop->get_upir_parent()))->get_simd())
     417             :           {
     418             :             // if simd+ multiple affected loops:  lastprivate().  We check collapse() to see if multiple loops are affected.
     419             :             // TODO: we need to check if collapse(val) val >=1
     420           0 :             if (hasClause(upir_loop->get_upir_parent(), V_SgOmpCollapseClause))
     421             :             {
     422             :               rt_val = e_lastprivate;
     423             :             }
     424             :             else
     425           0 :               rt_val = e_linear;
     426           0 :             return rt_val;
     427             :           }
     428             :           else
     429             :           {
     430             :             //cerr<<"found a loop index, but enclosing body statement is not omp for, but "<<omp_clause_body_stmt->class_name() <<endl;
     431             :           }
     432             :         }
     433             :         // Important algorithm step here:
     434             :         // No this logic in the specification, but I split the combined parallel for into two constructs, need to double check this
     435             :         // another case is parallel region + single region, we need to get the parallel region's attribute
     436             :         // Similar handling for simd directives, going after parent omp parallel or omp for if there is any, to find out the attributes.
     437             :         //   parallel+ for + simd: three levels
     438             :        //
     439             :        //    #pragma omp parallel private(i,j)
     440             :        //      {
     441             :        //        for (i = 0; i < LOOPCOUNT; i++)
     442             :        //          {
     443             :        //    #pragma omp single copyprivate(j)
     444             :        //            {
     445             :        //              nr_iterations++;
     446             :        //              j = i;   // i should be private, based on enclosing parallel region's info.
     447             :        //            }
     448             :        //       }
     449             :        //
     450             :         // If implicit rules do not apply at this level (worksharing regions like single), Go to find higher level: most omp parallel
     451           0 :         if  (SgUpirFieldBodyStatement * parent_clause_body_stmt = findEnclosingUpirFieldBodyStatement (getEnclosingStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt->get_parent())))
     452             :         {
     453             :           //if (isSgUpirSpmdStatement (parent_clause_body_stmt) && ( isSgUpirWorksharingStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt)|| isSgOmpSingleStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt)  ) )
     454             :           //if (isSgUpirSpmdStatement (parent_clause_body_stmt) &&  isSgOmpSingleStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt))
     455             :           // TODO: add other directives which may be nested within others
     456           0 :           if (isSgUpirWorksharingStatement (omp_clause_body_stmt) ||
     457           0 :               isSgUpirSimdStatement (omp_clause_body_stmt) ||
     458           0 :               isSgOmpSingleStatement(omp_clause_body_stmt))
     459             :           {
     460             :             // we need to consider the variable's data sharing attribute in the new context
     461             :             // the body of parallel can be the single region again, causing infinite recursive calls.
     462             :             //rt_val = getDataSharingAttribute (sym, parent_clause_body_stmt->get_body());

     464           0 :             return rt_val;
     465             :           }
     466             :         }
     467             : 
     468             :     // TODO: If an array section is a list item in a map clause on the target construct and the array section is
     469             :     // derived from a variable for which the type is pointer then that variable is firstprivate.
     470             :      } // end explicit unknown
     471             : 
     472             :     // the rest is shared by default
     473             :     // TODO Objects with dynamic storage duration are shared.
     474             :     // TODO Static data members are shared.
     475             : 
     476             :     } // end of has an OpenMP enclosing clause body statement
     477             :     else //orphaned code segments
     478             :     {
     479             : /*
     480             :     For the data race detection project, we choose to inline everything. So the implementation of orphaned segs is lower priority.
     481             :   //TODO: handle more cases as needed.
     482             :   Variables with static storage duration that are declared in called routines in the region are shared.
     483             : 
     484             :   File-scope or namespace-scope variables referenced in called routines in the region are shared
     485             :    unless they appear in a threadprivate directive.
     486             : 
     487             :    Objects with dynamic storage duration are shared.
     488             : 
     489             :    Static data members are shared unless they appear in a threadprivate directive.
     490             : 
     491             :    In C++, formal arguments of called routines in the region that are passed by reference have the
     492             :     same data-sharing attributes as the associated actual arguments.
     493             : 
     494             :    Other variables declared in called routines in the region are private.
     495             : */
     496           0 :       if (isThreadprivate (sym))
     497             :       {
     498           0 :         rt_val = e_threadprivate;
     499             :         return rt_val;
     500             :       }
     501             :       else
     502             :       {
     503             :         //find locally declared variables
     504           0 :         SgDeclarationStatement* var_decl = iname->get_declaration();
     505           0 :         SgFunctionDefinition* func_def = getEnclosingFunctionDefinition (anchor_stmt);
     506           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT (func_def != NULL);
     507           0 :         if (isAncestor (func_def, var_decl))
     508             :         {
     509           0 :           rt_val = e_private;
     510             :           return rt_val;
     511             :         }
     512             :         // if it is within a main function, it should be private no matter what. Single sequential region, not shared with others.
     513           0 :         if (isMain (func_def->get_declaration()))
     514             :         {
     515           0 :           rt_val = e_private;
     516           0 :           return rt_val;
     517             :         }
     518             :       }
     519             :     } // end of orphaned code segments
     520             : 
     521             :     return  rt_val;
     522             :   }

     540             :   //! Patch up all variables to make them explicit in data-sharing explicit

     542             :   {

     549             :

     880             :   //! Create a stride expression from an existing stride expression based on the loop iteration's order (incremental or decremental)
     881             :   // The assumption is orig_stride is just the raw operand of the condition expression of a loop
     882             :   // so it has to be adjusted to reflect the real stride: *(-1) if decremental
     883           0 :   static SgExpression* createAdjustedStride(SgExpression* orig_stride, bool isIncremental)
     884             :   {

     891             :        *  it should be i+= -1  for decremental loops

     901             :   //! check if an omp for/do loop use static schedule or not
     902             :   // Static schedule include: default schedule, or schedule(static[,chunk_size])
     903           0 :   bool useStaticSchedule(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* omp_loop)
     904             :   {
     905           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(omp_loop);
     906           0 :     bool result= false;
     907           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> clauses = getClause(omp_loop, V_SgOmpScheduleClause);
     908           0 :     if (clauses.size()==0)
     909             :     {
     910             :       result = true; // default schedule is static
     911             :     }else
     912             :     {
     913           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(clauses.size() ==1);
     914           0 :       SgOmpScheduleClause* s_clause = isSgOmpScheduleClause(clauses[0]);
     915           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(s_clause);
     916           0 :       if (s_clause->get_kind() == SgOmpClause::e_omp_schedule_kind_static)
     917           0 :         result = true;
     918             :     }
     919           0 :     return result;
     920             :   }
     921             : 
     922             :   // Chunk size  for dynamic and guided schedule should be 1 if not specified.
     923           0 :   static SgExpression* createAdjustedChunkSize(SgExpression* orig_chunk_size )
     924             :   {
     925           0 :     SgExpression* result = NULL;
     926           0 :     if (orig_chunk_size)
     927           0 :       result = copyExpression(orig_chunk_size);
     928             :     else
     929           0 :       result = buildIntVal(1);
     930           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(result != NULL);

    1091             :   // bb1 is the basic block to insert the translated loop
    1092             :   // bb1 already has compiler-generated variable declarations for new loop control variables
    1093             :   /*

    1337             :       // insert the loop into do-while
    1338           0 :       appendStatement(loop, do_body);
    1339           0 :       if (s_kind != SgOmpClause::e_omp_schedule_kind_dynamic) {
    1340           0 :           SgExpression* increase_lower_bound = buildPlusAssignOp(buildVarRefExp(lower_decl), buildVarRefExp(stride_decl));
    1341           0 :           SgExprStatement* increase_lower_bound_stmt = buildExprStatement(increase_lower_bound);
    1342           0 :           appendStatement(increase_lower_bound_stmt, do_body);
    1343           0 :           SgExpression* increase_upper_bound = buildPlusAssignOp(buildVarRefExp(upper_decl), buildVarRefExp(stride_decl));
    1344           0 :           SgExprStatement* increase_upper_bound_stmt = buildExprStatement(increase_upper_bound);
    1345           0 :           appendStatement(increase_upper_bound_stmt, do_body);
    1346           0 :           parameters = buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(0), thread_global_tid);
    1347           0 :           appendStatement(buildFunctionCallStmt("__kmpc_for_static_fini", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1), bb1);
    1348             :       };
    1349             :     }
    1350             :     // Liao 1/7/2011, Fortran does not support SgDoWhileStmt
    1351             :     // We use the following control flow as an alternative:
    1352             :     //   label  continue
    1353             :     //          loop_here
    1354             :     //          if (GOMP_loop_static_next (&_p_lower, &_p_upper))
    1355             :     //             goto label
    1356           0 :     else if (do_loop)
    1357             :     {
    1358           0 :       SgFunctionDefinition * funcDef = getEnclosingFunctionDefinition(bb1);
    1359           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT (funcDef != NULL);
    1360             :       // label  CONTINUE
    1361           0 :       SgLabelStatement * label_stmt_1 = buildLabelStatement("", NULL);
    1362           0 :       appendStatement(label_stmt_1, true_body);
    1363           0 :       int l_val = suggestNextNumericLabel(funcDef);
    1364           0 :       setFortranNumericLabel(label_stmt_1, l_val);
    1365             :       // loop here
    1366           0 :       appendStatement(loop, true_body);
    1367             :       // if () goto label
    1368           0 :       func_next_exp = buildFunctionCallExp(generateGOMPLoopNextFuncName(hasOrder, s_kind), buildIntType(), n_exp_list, bb1);
    1369           0 :       SgIfStmt * if_stmt_2 = buildIfStmt(buildEqualityOp(func_next_exp,buildIntVal(1)), buildBasicBlock(), buildBasicBlock());
    1370           0 :       SgGotoStatement* gt_stmt = buildGotoStatement(label_stmt_1->get_numeric_label()->get_symbol());
    1371           0 :       appendStatement (gt_stmt, isSgScopeStatement(if_stmt_2->get_true_body()));
    1372           0 :       appendStatement(if_stmt_2,true_body);
    1373             :       // assertion from unparser
    1374           0 :       SgStatementPtrList & statementList = isSgBasicBlock(if_stmt_2->get_true_body())->get_statements();
    1375           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(statementList.size() == 1);
    1376             :     }
    1377             : 
    1378             :     // Rewrite loop control variables
    1379           0 :     replaceVariableReferences(loop,isSgVariableSymbol(orig_index->get_symbol_from_symbol_table ()), getFirstVarSym(index_decl));
    1380           0 :     SageInterface::setLoopLowerBound(loop, buildVarRefExp(lower_decl));
    1381           0 :     SageInterface::setLoopUpperBound(loop, buildVarRefExp(upper_decl));
    1382           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (orig_upper != NULL);
    1383           0 :     transOmpVariables(target, bb1, orig_upper); // This should happen before the barrier is inserted.
    1384           0 :     if (!hasClause(target, V_SgOmpNowaitClause))
    1385             :     {
    1386           0 :       parameters = buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(0), thread_global_tid);
    1387           0 :       appendStatement(buildFunctionCallStmt("__kmpc_barrier", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1), bb1);
    1388             :     }
    1389           0 :   }
    1390             : 
    1391           0 :   void transUpirLoopParallel(SgNode* node) {
    1392           0 :     SgUpirLoopParallelStatement* target = isSgUpirLoopParallelStatement(node);
    1393           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(target != NULL);
    1394             : 
    1395             :     //TODO: for simd combined directive
    1396           0 :     SgUpirWorksharingStatement* worksharing = isSgUpirWorksharingStatement(target->get_worksharing());
    1397           0 :     SgUpirSimdStatement* simd = isSgUpirSimdStatement(target->get_simd());
    1398           0 :     if (worksharing != NULL) {
    1399           0 :         transOmpLoop(target);
    1400             :     }
    1401           0 :     else if (simd != NULL) {
    1402           0 :         transOmpSimd(target);
    1403             :     }
    1404             :     else {
    1405           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(0);
    1406           0 :     };
    1407           0 :   }
    1408             : 
    1409             :   // Expected AST
    1410             :   // * SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    1411             :   // ** SgForStatement
    1412             :   // Algorithm:
    1413             :   // Loop normalization first  for stop condition expressions
    1414             :   //   <: for (i= 0;i <20; i++) --> for (i= 0;i <20; i+=1)  [0,20, +1] to pass to runtime calls
    1415             :   //  <=: for (i= 0;i<=20; i++) --> for (i= 0;i <21; i+=1)
    1416             :   //   >: for (i=20;i >-1; i--) --> for (i=20;i >-1; i-=1) [20, -1, -1]
    1417             :   //  >=: for (i=20;i>= 0; i--) --> for (i=20;i >-1; i-=1)
    1418             :   // We have a SageInterface::forLoopNormalization() which does the opposite (normalizing a C loop to a Fortran style loop)
    1419             :   // < --> <= and > --> >=,
    1420             :   // GCC-GOMP use compiler-generated statements to schedule loop iterations using static schedule
    1421             :   // All other schedule policies use runtime calls instead.
    1422             :   // We translate static schedule here and non-static ones in transOmpLoop_others()
    1423             :   //
    1424             :   // Static schedule, including:
    1425             :   //1. default (static even) case
    1426             :   //2. schedule(static[, chunk_size]): == static even if chunk_size is not specified
    1427             :   // gomp does not provide a runtime call to calculate loop control values
    1428             :   // for the default (static even) scheduling
    1429             :   // compilers have to generate the statements to do this. I HATE THIS!!!
    1430             :   // the loop scheduling algorithm for the default case is
    1431             :   /*
    1432             :   // calculate loop iteration count from lower, upper and stride , no -1 if upper is an inclusive bound
    1433             :   int _p_iter_count = (stride + -1 + upper - lower )/stride;
    1434             :   // calculate a proper chunk size
    1435             :   // two cases: evenly divisible  20/5 =4
    1436             :   //   not evenly divisible 20/3= 6
    1437             :   // Initial candidate
    1438             : 
    1439             :   int _p_num_threads = omp_get_num_threads ();
    1440             :   _p_chunk_size = _p_iter_count / _p_num_threads;
    1441             :   int _p_ck_temp = (_p_chunk_size * _p_num_threads) != _p_iter_count;
    1442             :   // increase the chunk size by 1 if not evenly divisible
    1443             :   _p_chunk_size = _p_ck_temp + _p_chunk_size;
    1444             : 
    1445             :   // decide on the lower and upper bound for the current thread
    1446             :   int _p_thread_id = omp_get_thread_num ();
    1447             :   _p_lower = lower + _p_chunk_size * _p_thread_id * stride;a
    1448             :   // -1 if upper is an inclusive bound
    1449             :   _p_upper = _p_lower + _p_chunk_size * stride;
    1450             : 
    1451             :   // adjust the upper bound
    1452             :   _p_upper = MIN_EXPR <_p_upper, upper>;
    1453             :   // _p_upper = _p_upper<upper? _p_upper: upper;
    1454             :   // Note: decremental iteration space needs some minor changes to the algorithm above.
    1455             :   // stride should be negated
    1456             :   // MIN_EXP should be MAX_EXP
    1457             :   // upper bound adjustment should be +1 instead of -1
    1458             :   */
    1459           0 :   void transOmpLoop(SgNode* node)
    1460             :   {
    1461           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL);
    1462           0 :     SgUpirLoopStatement* target = NULL;
    1463           0 :     SgUpirLoopParallelStatement* loop_parallel = isSgUpirLoopParallelStatement(node);
    1464           0 :     target = isSgUpirLoopStatement(loop_parallel->get_loop());
    1465             : 
    1466           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (target != NULL);
    1467             : 
    1468           0 :     SgScopeStatement* p_scope = target->get_scope();
    1469           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (p_scope != NULL);
    1470             : 
    1471           0 :     SgStatement* body = target->get_body();
    1472           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(body != NULL);
    1473             :     // The OpenMP syntax requires that the omp for pragma is immediately followed by the for loop.
    1474           0 :     SgForStatement * for_loop = isSgForStatement(body);
    1475           0 :     SgFortranDo * do_loop = isSgFortranDo(body);
    1476             : 
    1477           0 :     SgStatement* loop = (for_loop!=NULL?(SgStatement*)for_loop:(SgStatement*)do_loop);
    1478           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (loop != NULL);
    1479             : 
    1480           0 :     SgExprListExp* parameters = NULL;
    1481           0 :     SgExpression* source_location_info = buildIntVal(0);
    1482             : 
    1483             :     // Step 1. Loop normalization
    1484             :     // we reuse the normalization from SageInterface, though it is different from what gomp expects.
    1485             :     // the point is to have a consistent loop form. We can adjust the difference later on.
    1486           0 :     if (for_loop)
    1487           0 :       SageInterface::forLoopNormalization(for_loop);
    1488           0 :     else if (do_loop)
    1489           0 :       SageInterface::doLoopNormalization(do_loop);
    1490             :     else
    1491             :     {
    1492           0 :       cerr<<"error! transOmpLoop(). loop is neither for_loop nor do_loop. Aborting.."<<endl;
    1493           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT (false);
    1494             :     }
    1495             : 
    1496           0 :     SgInitializedName * orig_index = NULL;
    1497           0 :     SgExpression* orig_lower = NULL;
    1498           0 :     SgExpression* orig_upper= NULL;
    1499           0 :     SgExpression* orig_stride= NULL;
    1500           0 :     bool isIncremental = true; // if the loop iteration space is incremental
    1501             :     // grab the original loop 's controlling information
    1502           0 :     bool is_canonical = false;
    1503           0 :     if (for_loop)
    1504           0 :       is_canonical = isCanonicalForLoop (for_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental);
    1505           0 :     else if (do_loop)
    1506           0 :       is_canonical = isCanonicalDoLoop (do_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental, NULL);
    1507           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(is_canonical == true);
    1508             : 
    1509             :     // step 2. Insert a basic block to replace SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    1510             :     // This newly introduced scope is used to hold loop variables, private variables ,etc
    1511           0 :     SgBasicBlock * bb1 = SageBuilder::buildBasicBlock();
    1512             : 
    1513           0 :     replaceStatement(loop_parallel, bb1, true);
    1514             : 
    1515             :     //TODO handle preprocessing information
    1516             :     // Save some preprocessing information for later restoration.
    1517             :     //  AttachedPreprocessingInfoType ppi_before, ppi_after;
    1518             :     //  ASTtools::cutPreprocInfo (s, PreprocessingInfo::before, ppi_before);
    1519             :     //  ASTtools::cutPreprocInfo (s, PreprocessingInfo::after, ppi_after);
    1520             : 
    1521             :     // Declare local loop control variables: _p_loop_index _p_loop_lower _p_loop_upper , no change to the original stride
    1522           0 :     SgType* loop_var_type  = NULL ;
    1523             :     // xomp interface expects long for some runtime calls now, 6/9/2010
    1524           0 :     if (for_loop)
    1525           0 :       loop_var_type = buildLongType();
    1526           0 :     else if (do_loop)  // No long integer in Fortran
    1527           0 :       loop_var_type = buildIntType();
    1528           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* index_decl = NULL;
    1529           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* lower_decl = NULL;
    1530           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* upper_decl = NULL;
    1531           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* last_iter_decl = NULL;
    1532           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* stride_decl = NULL;
    1533             : 
    1534           0 :     if (SageInterface::is_Fortran_language() )
    1535             :     {// special rules to insert variable declarations in Fortran
    1536             :       // They have to be inserted to enclosing function body or enclosing parallel region body
    1537             :       // and after existing declaration statement sequence, if any.
    1538           0 :       nCounter ++;
    1539           0 :       index_decl = buildAndInsertDeclarationForOmp("p_index_"+StringUtility::numberToString(nCounter), loop_var_type , NULL,bb1);
    1540           0 :       lower_decl = buildAndInsertDeclarationForOmp("p_lower_"+StringUtility::numberToString(nCounter), loop_var_type , NULL,bb1);
    1541           0 :       upper_decl = buildAndInsertDeclarationForOmp("p_upper_"+StringUtility::numberToString(nCounter), loop_var_type , NULL,bb1);
    1542             :     }
    1543             :     else
    1544             :     {
    1545           0 :       index_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("__index_", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1546           0 :       lower_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("__lower_", buildIntType(), buildAssignInitializer(orig_lower), bb1);
    1547           0 :       upper_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("__upper_", buildIntType(), buildAssignInitializer(orig_upper), bb1);
    1548           0 :       stride_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("__stride_", buildIntType(), buildAssignInitializer(orig_stride), bb1);
    1549           0 :       last_iter_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("__last_iter_", buildIntType(), buildAssignInitializer(buildIntVal(0)), bb1);
    1550             : 
    1551           0 :       appendStatement(index_decl, bb1);
    1552           0 :       appendStatement(lower_decl, bb1);
    1553           0 :       appendStatement(upper_decl, bb1);
    1554           0 :       appendStatement(stride_decl, bb1);
    1555           0 :       appendStatement(last_iter_decl, bb1);
    1556             :     }
    1557             : 
    1558           0 :     bool hasOrder = false;
    1559           0 :     if (hasClause(target, V_SgOmpOrderedClause))
    1560           0 :       hasOrder = true;
    1561             : 
    1562             :     // Grab or calculate chunk_size
    1563             : //    SgExpression* my_chunk_size = NULL;
    1564           0 :     bool hasSpecifiedSize = false;
    1565           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> clauses = getClause(target, V_SgOmpScheduleClause);
    1566           0 :     if (clauses.size() !=0)
    1567             :     {
    1568           0 :       SgOmpScheduleClause* s_clause = isSgOmpScheduleClause(clauses[0]);
    1569           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(s_clause);
    1570             :       //SgOmpClause::omp_schedule_kind_enum s_kind = s_clause->get_kind();
    1571             :       // ROSE_ASSERT(s_kind == SgOmpClause::e_omp_schedule_static);
    1572           0 :       SgExpression* orig_chunk_size = s_clause->get_chunk_size();
    1573             :       //  ROSE_ASSERT(orig_chunk_size->get_parent() != NULL);
    1574           0 :       if (orig_chunk_size)
    1575             :       {
    1576           0 :         hasSpecifiedSize = true;
    1577             :         //my_chunk_size = orig_chunk_size;
    1578             :       }
    1579             :     }
    1580             : 
    1581             :     //  step 3. Translation for omp for
    1582           0 :     if (!useStaticSchedule(target) || hasOrder || hasSpecifiedSize)
    1583             :     {
    1584           0 :       transOmpLoop_others(target, index_decl, lower_decl, upper_decl, stride_decl, last_iter_decl, bb1);
    1585             :     }
    1586             :     else
    1587             :     {
    1588           0 :       SgVariableDeclaration* kmpc_global_tid_declaration = get_kmpc_global_tid(node, bb1);
    1589           0 :       SgExpression* thread_global_tid = buildVarRefExp(getFirstVariable(*kmpc_global_tid_declaration).get_name(), bb1);
    1590           0 :       appendStatement(kmpc_global_tid_declaration, bb1);
    1591             : 
    1592             :       //void XOMP_loop_default(int lower, int upper, int stride, long *n_lower, long * n_upper)
    1593             :       // XOMP_loop_default (lower, upper, stride, &_p_lower, &_p_upper );
    1594             :       // lower:  copyExpression(orig_lower)
    1595             :       // upper: copyExpression(orig_upper)
    1596             :       // stride: copyExpression(orig_stride)
    1597             :       // n_lower: buildVarRefExp(lower_decl)
    1598             :       // n_upper: buildVarRefExp(upper_decl)
    1599           0 :       SgExpression* e4 = NULL;
    1600           0 :       SgExpression* e5 = NULL;
    1601           0 :       if (for_loop)
    1602             :       {
    1603           0 :         e4= buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp(lower_decl));
    1604           0 :         e5= buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp(upper_decl));
    1605             :       }
    1606           0 :       else if (do_loop)
    1607             :       {// Fortran, pass-by-reference by default
    1608           0 :         e4= buildVarRefExp(lower_decl);
    1609           0 :         e5= buildVarRefExp(upper_decl);
    1610             :       }
    1611           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT (e4&&e5);
    1612             :       // by default, LLVM uses 34 as the scheduling policy enum
    1613           0 :       SgExpression* schedule_type = buildIntVal(kmp_sched_static_nochunk);
    1614           0 :       parameters = buildExprListExp(source_location_info, thread_global_tid, schedule_type, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp(last_iter_decl)), e4, e5, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp(stride_decl)), copyExpression(orig_stride), buildIntVal(1));
    1615           0 :       SgStatement* call_stmt = buildFunctionCallStmt ("__kmpc_for_static_init_4", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1);
    1616           0 :       appendStatement(call_stmt, bb1);
    1617             : 
    1618             :       // insert the upper bound checking
    1619           0 :       SgExpression* if_condition = NULL;
    1620           0 :       if (isIncremental) {
    1621           0 :         if_condition = buildGreaterThanOp(buildVarRefExp(upper_decl), copyExpression(orig_upper));
    1622             :       }
    1623             :       else {
    1624           0 :         if_condition = buildLessThanOp(buildVarRefExp(upper_decl), copyExpression(orig_upper));
    1625           0 :       };
    1626           0 :       SgExprStatement* update_upper_bound_stmt = buildAssignStatement(buildVarRefExp(upper_decl), copyExpression(orig_upper));
    1627           0 :       SgIfStmt* if_statement = buildIfStmt(if_condition, update_upper_bound_stmt, NULL);
    1628           0 :       appendStatement(if_statement, bb1);
    1629             : 
    1630             :       // add loop here
    1631           0 :       SgStatement* new_loop = deepCopy(loop);
    1632           0 :       appendStatement(new_loop, bb1);
    1633             :       // replace loop index with the new one
    1634           0 :       replaceVariableReferences(new_loop,
    1635           0 :           isSgVariableSymbol(orig_index->get_symbol_from_symbol_table()), getFirstVarSym(index_decl))    ;
    1636             :       // rewrite the lower and upper bounds
    1637           0 :       SageInterface::setLoopLowerBound(new_loop, buildVarRefExp(lower_decl));
    1638           0 :       SageInterface::setLoopUpperBound(new_loop, buildVarRefExp(upper_decl));
    1639             : 
    1640             :       // TODO: implement UPIR: transUpirVariables(loop_parallel, bb1, orig_upper);
    1641           0 :       transOmpVariables(target, bb1,orig_upper); // This should happen before the barrier is inserted.
    1642           0 :       parameters = buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(0), thread_global_tid);
    1643           0 :       appendStatement(buildFunctionCallStmt("__kmpc_for_static_fini", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1), bb1);
    1644             :       // insert barrier if there is no nowait clause
    1645           0 :       if (!hasClause(target, V_SgOmpNowaitClause))
    1646             :       {
    1647           0 :         appendStatement(buildFunctionCallStmt("__kmpc_barrier", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1), bb1);
    1648             :       }
    1649             :     }
    1650             : 
    1651           0 :   } // end trans omp for
    1652             : 
    1653             : 
    1654             :   //! Translate omp for or omp do loops affected by the "omp target" directive, Liao 1/28/2013
    1655             :   /*
    1656             : 
    1657             : Example:
    1658             :   // for (i = 0; i < N; i++)
    1659             :   { // top level block, prepare to be outlined.
    1660             :   // int i ; // = blockDim.x * blockIdx.x + threadIdx.x; // this CUDA declaration can be inserted later
    1661             :   i = getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables(1);
    1662             : 
    1663             :   if (i<SIZE)  // boundary checking to avoid invalid memory accesses
    1664             :   {
    1665             :   for (j = 0; j < M; j++)
    1666             :   for (k = 0; k < K; k++)
    1667             :   c[i][j]= c[i][j]+a[i][k]*b[k][j];
    1668             :   }
    1669             :   } // end of top level block
    1670             : 
    1671             : Algorithm:
    1672             :    * check if it is a OmpTargetLoop
    1673             :    * loop normalization
    1674             :    * replace UpirWorksharingStatement with a block: bb1
    1675             :    * declare int _dev_i within bb1;  replace for loop bodys loop index with _dev_i;
    1676             :    * build if stmt with correct condition
    1677             :    * move loop body to if-stmts true body
    1678             :    * remove for_loop
    1679             :    */
    1680           0 :   void transOmpTargetLoop(SgNode* node)
    1681             :   {
    1682             :     //step 0: Sanity check
    1683           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL);
    1684           0 :     SgUpirWorksharingStatement* target1 = isSgUpirWorksharingStatement(node);
    1685           0 :     SgOmpDoStatement* target2 = isSgOmpDoStatement(node);
    1686             : 
    1687           0 :     SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* target = (target1!=NULL?(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement*)target1:(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement*)target2);
    1688           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (target != NULL);
    1689             : 
    1690           0 :     SgScopeStatement* p_scope = target->get_scope();
    1691           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (p_scope != NULL);
    1692             : 
    1693           0 :     SgStatement * body =  target->get_body();
    1694           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(body != NULL);
    1695             :     // The OpenMP syntax requires that the omp for pragma is immediately followed by the for loop.
    1696           0 :     SgForStatement * for_loop = isSgForStatement(body);
    1697           0 :     SgFortranDo * do_loop = isSgFortranDo(body);
    1698             : 
    1699           0 :     SgStatement* loop = (for_loop!=NULL?(SgStatement*)for_loop:(SgStatement*)do_loop);
    1700           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (loop != NULL);
    1701             : 
    1702             :     // make sure this is really a loop affected by "omp target"
    1703             :     //bool is_target_loop = false;
    1704           0 :     SgNode* parent = node->get_parent();
    1705           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (parent != NULL);
    1706           0 :     if (isSgBasicBlock(parent)) // skip one possible BB between omp parallel and omp for.
    1707           0 :       parent = parent->get_parent();
    1708           0 :     SgNode* grand_parent = parent->get_parent();
    1709           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (grand_parent != NULL);
    1710           0 :     SgUpirSpmdStatement* parent_parallel = isSgUpirSpmdStatement (parent) ;
    1711           0 :     SgUpirTaskStatement* grand_target = isSgUpirTaskStatement(grand_parent);
    1712           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (parent_parallel !=NULL);
    1713           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (grand_target !=NULL);
    1714             : 
    1715             :     // Step 1. Loop normalization
    1716             :     // For the init statement: for (int i=0;... ) becomes int i; for (i=0;..)
    1717             :     // For test expression: i<x is normalized to i<= (x-1) and i>x is normalized to i>= (x+1)
    1718             :     // For increment expression: i++ is normalized to i+=1 and i-- is normalized to i+=-1 i-=s is normalized to i+= -s
    1719           0 :     if (for_loop)
    1720           0 :       SageInterface::forLoopNormalization(for_loop);
    1721           0 :     else if (do_loop)
    1722           0 :       SageInterface::doLoopNormalization(do_loop);
    1723             :     else
    1724             :     {
    1725           0 :       cerr<<"error! transOmpLoop(). loop is neither for_loop nor do_loop. Aborting.."<<endl;
    1726           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT (false);
    1727             :     }
    1728             : 
    1729           0 :     SgInitializedName * orig_index = NULL;
    1730           0 :     SgExpression* orig_lower = NULL;
    1731           0 :     SgExpression* orig_upper= NULL;
    1732           0 :     SgExpression* orig_stride= NULL;
    1733           0 :     bool isIncremental = true; // if the loop iteration space is incremental
    1734             :     // grab the original loop 's controlling information
    1735           0 :     bool is_canonical = false;
    1736             : 
    1737           0 :     if (for_loop)
    1738           0 :       is_canonical = isCanonicalForLoop (for_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental);
    1739           0 :     else if (do_loop)
    1740           0 :       is_canonical = isCanonicalDoLoop (do_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental, NULL);
    1741           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(is_canonical == true);
    1742             : 
    1743             :     // loop iteration space: upper - lower + 1
    1744             :     // This expression will be later used to help generate xomp_get_max1DBlock(VEC_LEN), which needs iteration count to calculate max thread block numbers
    1745           0 :     cuda_loop_iter_count_1 = buildAddOp(buildSubtractOp(deepCopy(orig_upper), deepCopy(orig_lower)), buildIntVal(1));
    1746             : 
    1747             :     // also make sure the loop body is a block
    1748             :     // TODO: we consider peeling off 1 level loop control only, need to be conditional on what the spec. can provide at pragma level
    1749             :     // TODO: Fortran support later on
    1750           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (for_loop != NULL);
    1751           0 :     SgBasicBlock* loop_body = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfFor (for_loop);
    1752             : 
    1753             : 
    1754             :     //Step 2. Insert a basic block to replace SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    1755             :     // This newly introduced scope is used to hold loop variables ,etc
    1756           0 :     SgBasicBlock * bb1 = SageBuilder::buildBasicBlock();
    1757           0 :     replaceStatement(target, bb1, true);
    1758             : 
    1759             :     //Step 3. Using device thread id and replace reference of original loop index with the thread index
    1760             :     // Declare device thread id variable
    1761             :     //int i = blockDim.x * blockIdx.x + threadIdx.x;
    1762             :     //SgAssignInitializer* init_idx =  buildAssignInitializer(
    1763             :     //                                     buildAddOp( buildMultiplyOp (buildVarRefExp("blockDim.x"), buildVarRefExp("blockIdx.x")) ,
    1764             :     //                                      buildVarRefExp("threadIdx.x", bb1)));
    1765             :     //Better build of CUDA variables within a runtime library call so these variables are hidden from the translation
    1766             :     //  getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables(1)
    1767           0 :     SgAssignInitializer* init_idx =  buildAssignInitializer(buildFunctionCallExp(SgName("getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables"), buildIntType(),buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(1)),bb1), buildIntType());
    1768             : 
    1769           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* dev_i_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("_dev_i", buildIntType(), init_idx, bb1);
    1770           0 :     prependStatement (dev_i_decl, bb1);
    1771           0 :     SgVariableSymbol* dev_i_symbol = getFirstVarSym (dev_i_decl);
    1772           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (dev_i_symbol != NULL);
    1773             : 
    1774             : #if 1 // test mysterious replace with _dev_i
    1775             :     // replace reference to loop index with reference to device i variable
    1776           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (orig_index != NULL);
    1777           0 :     SgSymbol * orig_symbol = orig_index ->get_symbol_from_symbol_table () ;
    1778           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (orig_symbol != NULL);
    1779             : 
    1780           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgNode*> nodeList = NodeQuery::querySubTree(loop_body, V_SgVarRefExp);
    1781           0 :     for (Rose_STL_Container<SgNode *>::iterator i = nodeList.begin(); i != nodeList.end(); i++)
    1782             :     {
    1783           0 :       SgVarRefExp *vRef = isSgVarRefExp((*i));
    1784           0 :       if (vRef->get_symbol() == orig_symbol)
    1785           0 :         vRef->set_symbol(dev_i_symbol);
    1786             :     }
    1787             : #endif
    1788             : 
    1789             :     // Step 4. build the if () condition statement, move the loop body into the true body
    1790             :     // Liao, 2/21/2013. We must be accurate about the range of iterations or the computation may result in WRONG results!!
    1791             :     // A classic example is the Jacobi iteration: in which the first and last iterations are not executed to make sure elements have boundaries.
    1792             :     // After normalization, we have inclusive lower and upper bounds of the input loop
    1793             :     // the condition of if() should look like something: if (_dev_i >=0+1 &&_dev_i <= (n - 1) - 1)  {...}
    1794           0 :     SgBasicBlock* true_body = buildBasicBlock();
    1795           0 :     SgExprStatement* cond_stmt = NULL;
    1796           0 :     if (isIncremental)
    1797             :     {
    1798           0 :       SgExpression* lhs = buildGreaterOrEqualOp (buildVarRefExp(dev_i_symbol), deepCopy(orig_lower));
    1799           0 :       SgExpression* rhs = buildLessOrEqualOp (buildVarRefExp(dev_i_symbol), deepCopy(orig_upper));
    1800           0 :       cond_stmt = buildExprStatement (buildAndOp(lhs, rhs));
    1801             :     }
    1802             :     else
    1803             :     {
    1804           0 :       cerr<<"error. transOmpTargetLoop(): decremental case is not yet handled !"<<endl;
    1805           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT (false);
    1806             :     }
    1807           0 :     SgIfStmt * if_stmt = buildIfStmt(cond_stmt, true_body, NULL);
    1808           0 :     appendStatement(if_stmt, bb1);
    1809           0 :     moveStatementsBetweenBlocks (loop_body, true_body);
    1810             :     // Peel off the original loop
    1811           0 :     removeStatement (for_loop);
    1812             : 
    1813             :     // handle private variables at this loop level, mostly loop index variables.
    1814             :     // TODO: this is not very elegant since the outer most loop's loop variable is still translated.
    1815             :     //for reduction
    1816           0 :     per_block_declarations.clear(); // must reset to empty or wrong reference to stale content generated previously
    1817           0 :     transOmpVariables(target, bb1,NULL, true);
    1818           0 :   }
    1819             : 
    1820             :   //! Translate omp for or omp do loops affected by the "omp target" directive, using a round robin-scheduler Liao 7/10/2014
    1821             :   /*  Algorithm
    1822             : 
    1823             :   // original loop info. grab from the loop structure
    1824             :   int orig_start =0;
    1825             :   int orig_end = n-1; // inclusive upper bound
    1826             :   int orig_step = 1;
    1827             :   int orig_chunk_size = 1;// fixed at 1
    1828             : 
    1829             :   // new lower and upper bound, to be filled out by the loop scheduler
    1830             :   int _dev_lower;
    1831             :   int _dev_upper;
    1832             :   int _dev_loop_chunk_size;
    1833             :   int _dev_loop_sched_index;
    1834             :   int _dev_loop_stride;
    1835             : 
    1836             :   // CUDA thread count and ID for the 1-D block
    1837             :   int _dev_thread_num = getCUDABlockThreadCount(1);
    1838             :   int _dev_thread_id = getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables(1);
    1839             : 
    1840             :   //initialize scheduler
    1841             :   XOMP_static_sched_init (orig_start, orig_end, orig_step, orig_chunk_size, _dev_thread_num, _dev_thread_id, \
    1842             :   & _dev_loop_chunk_size , & _dev_loop_sched_index, & _dev_loop_stride);
    1843             : 
    1844             :   while (XOMP_static_sched_next (&_dev_loop_sched_index, orig_end, orig_step,_dev_loop_stride, _dev_loop_chunk_size, _dev_thread_num, _dev_thread_id, & _dev_lower
    1845             :   , & _dev_upper))
    1846             :   {
    1847             :   for (i= _dev_lower ; i <= _dev_upper; i ++ ) { // rewrite lower and upper bound and step normalized to 1
    1848             :   // original loop body here
    1849             :   }
    1850             :   }
    1851             :   }
    1852             : 
    1853             :  */
    1854           0 : void transOmpTargetLoop_RoundRobin(SgNode* node)
    1855             : {
    1856             :   //step 0: Sanity check
    1857           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL);
    1858           0 :   SgUpirWorksharingStatement* target1 = isSgUpirWorksharingStatement(node);
    1859           0 :   SgOmpDoStatement* target2 = isSgOmpDoStatement(node);
    1860             : 
    1861             :   // the target of the translation is a SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    1862           0 :   SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* target = (target1!=NULL?(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement*)target1:(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement*)target2);
    1863           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (target != NULL);
    1864             : 
    1865           0 :   SgScopeStatement* p_scope = target->get_scope();
    1866           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (p_scope != NULL);
    1867             : 
    1868           0 :   SgStatement * body =  target->get_body();
    1869           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(body != NULL);
    1870             :   // The OpenMP syntax requires that the omp for pragma is immediately followed by the for loop.
    1871           0 :   SgForStatement * for_loop = isSgForStatement(body);
    1872           0 :   SgFortranDo * do_loop = isSgFortranDo(body);
    1873             : 
    1874           0 :   SgStatement* loop = (for_loop!=NULL?(SgStatement*)for_loop:(SgStatement*)do_loop);
    1875           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (loop != NULL);
    1876             : 
    1877             :   // make sure this is really a loop affected by "omp target"
    1878             :   //bool is_target_loop = false;
    1879           0 :   SgNode* parent = node->get_parent();
    1880           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (parent != NULL);
    1881           0 :   if (isSgBasicBlock(parent)) // skip one possible BB between omp parallel and omp for.
    1882           0 :     parent = parent->get_parent();
    1883           0 :   SgNode* grand_parent = parent->get_parent();
    1884           0 :   if (isSgBasicBlock(grand_parent)) // skip one possible BB between omp target and omp parallel.
    1885           0 :     grand_parent = grand_parent->get_parent();
    1886           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (grand_parent != NULL);
    1887           0 :   SgUpirSpmdStatement* parent_parallel = isSgUpirSpmdStatement (parent) ;
    1888           0 :   SgUpirTaskStatement* grand_target = isSgUpirTaskStatement(grand_parent);
    1889           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (parent_parallel !=NULL);
    1890           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (grand_target !=NULL);
    1891             : 
    1892             :   // Step 1. Loop normalization
    1893             :   // For the init statement: for (int i=0;... ) becomes int i; for (i=0;..)
    1894             :   // For test expression: i<x is normalized to i<= (x-1) and i>x is normalized to i>= (x+1)
    1895             :   // For increment expression: i++ is normalized to i+=1 and i-- is normalized to i+=-1 i-=s is normalized to i+= -s
    1896           0 :   if (for_loop)
    1897           0 :     SageInterface::forLoopNormalization(for_loop);
    1898           0 :   else if (do_loop)
    1899           0 :     SageInterface::doLoopNormalization(do_loop);
    1900             :   else
    1901             :   {
    1902           0 :     cerr<<"error! transOmpLoop(). loop is neither for_loop nor do_loop. Aborting.."<<endl;
    1903           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (false);
    1904             :   }
    1905             : 
    1906           0 :   SgInitializedName * orig_index = NULL;
    1907           0 :   SgExpression* orig_lower = NULL;
    1908           0 :   SgExpression* orig_upper= NULL;
    1909           0 :   SgExpression* orig_stride= NULL;
    1910           0 :   bool isIncremental = true; // if the loop iteration space is incremental
    1911             :   // grab the original loop 's controlling information
    1912           0 :   bool is_canonical = false;
    1913             : 
    1914           0 :   if (for_loop)
    1915           0 :     is_canonical = isCanonicalForLoop (for_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental);
    1916           0 :   else if (do_loop)
    1917           0 :     is_canonical = isCanonicalDoLoop (do_loop, &orig_index, & orig_lower, &orig_upper, &orig_stride, NULL, &isIncremental, NULL);
    1918           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(is_canonical == true);
    1919             : 
    1920             :   // loop iteration space: upper - lower + 1, not used within this function, but a global variable used later.
    1921             :   // This expression will be later used to help generate xomp_get_max1DBlock(VEC_LEN), which needs iteration count to calculate max thread block numbers
    1922           0 :   cuda_loop_iter_count_1 = buildAddOp(buildSubtractOp(deepCopy(orig_upper), deepCopy(orig_lower)), buildIntVal(1));
    1923             : 
    1924             :   // TODO: Fortran support later on
    1925           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (for_loop != NULL);
    1926             :   //SgBasicBlock* loop_body = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfFor (for_loop);
    1927             : 
    1928             :   //Step 2. Insert a basic block to replace SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    1929             :   // This newly introduced scope is used to hold loop variables ,etc
    1930           0 :   SgBasicBlock * bb1 = SageBuilder::buildBasicBlock();
    1931           0 :   replaceStatement(target, bb1, true);
    1932             : 
    1933             :   // Insert variables used by the two scheduler functions
    1934             :   /* int _dev_lower;
    1935             :      int _dev_upper;
    1936             :      int _dev_loop_chunk_size;
    1937             :      int _dev_loop_sched_index;
    1938             :      int _dev_loop_stride;
    1939             :   */
    1940           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_lower_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ("_dev_lower", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1941           0 :   appendStatement (dev_lower_decl, bb1);
    1942           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_upper_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ("_dev_upper", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1943           0 :   appendStatement (dev_upper_decl, bb1);
    1944           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_loop_chunk_size_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ("_dev_loop_chunk_size", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1945           0 :   appendStatement (dev_loop_chunk_size_decl, bb1);
    1946           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_loop_sched_index_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ("_dev_loop_sched_index", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1947           0 :   appendStatement (dev_loop_sched_index_decl , bb1);
    1948           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_loop_stride_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ("_dev_loop_stride", buildIntType(), NULL, bb1);
    1949           0 :   appendStatement (dev_loop_stride_decl, bb1);
    1950             : 
    1951             :   // Insert CUDA thread id and count declarations
    1952             :   // int _dev_thread_num = getCUDABlockThreadCount(1);
    1953           0 :   SgAssignInitializer* init_idx =  buildAssignInitializer(buildFunctionCallExp(SgName("getCUDABlockThreadCount"), buildIntType(),buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(1)),bb1), buildIntType());
    1954           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_thread_num_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("_dev_thread_num", buildIntType(), init_idx, bb1);
    1955           0 :   appendStatement (dev_thread_num_decl, bb1);
    1956           0 :   SgVariableSymbol* dev_thread_num_symbol = getFirstVarSym (dev_thread_num_decl);
    1957           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (dev_thread_num_symbol!= NULL);
    1958             : 
    1959             :   // int _dev_thread_id = getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables(1);
    1960           0 :   init_idx =  buildAssignInitializer(buildFunctionCallExp(SgName("getLoopIndexFromCUDAVariables"), buildIntType(),buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(1)),bb1), buildIntType());
    1961           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration* dev_thread_id_decl = buildVariableDeclaration("_dev_thread_id", buildIntType(), init_idx, bb1);
    1962           0 :   appendStatement (dev_thread_id_decl, bb1);
    1963           0 :   SgVariableSymbol* dev_thread_id_symbol = getFirstVarSym (dev_thread_id_decl);
    1964           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (dev_thread_id_symbol!= NULL);
    1965             : 
    1966             :   // initialize scheduler
    1967             :   // XOMP_static_sched_init (orig_start, orig_end, orig_step, orig_chunk_size, _dev_thread_num, _dev_thread_id,
    1968             :   //                       & _dev_loop_chunk_size , & _dev_loop_sched_index, & _dev_loop_stride);
    1969           0 :   SgExprListExp* parameters  = buildExprListExp(copyExpression (orig_lower), copyExpression (orig_upper), copyExpression(orig_stride), buildIntVal(1), buildVarRefExp(dev_thread_num_symbol), buildVarRefExp (dev_thread_id_symbol) );
    1970           0 :   appendExpression (parameters, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_chunk_size_decl))) );
    1971           0 :   appendExpression (parameters, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_sched_index_decl))) );
    1972           0 :   appendExpression (parameters, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_stride_decl))) );
    1973           0 :   SgStatement* call_stmt = buildFunctionCallStmt ("XOMP_static_sched_init", buildVoidType(), parameters, bb1);
    1974           0 :   appendStatement (call_stmt, bb1);
    1975             : 
    1976             :   // function call exp as while (condition)
    1977             :   // XOMP_static_sched_next (&_dev_loop_sched_index, orig_end, orig_step,_dev_loop_stride, _dev_loop_chunk_size,
    1978             :   //                       _dev_thread_num, _dev_thread_id, & _dev_lower , & _dev_upper)
    1979           0 :   parameters = buildExprListExp (buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_sched_index_decl))), copyExpression (orig_upper), copyExpression(orig_stride),buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_stride_decl)),  buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_loop_chunk_size_decl)));
    1980           0 :   appendExpression (parameters,buildVarRefExp(dev_thread_num_symbol));
    1981           0 :   appendExpression (parameters,buildVarRefExp(dev_thread_id_symbol));
    1982           0 :   appendExpression (parameters, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_lower_decl))) );
    1983           0 :   appendExpression (parameters, buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_upper_decl))) );
    1984           0 :   SgExpression* func_call_exp = buildFunctionCallExp ("XOMP_static_sched_next", buildBoolType(), parameters, bb1);
    1985             : 
    1986           0 :   SgStatement* new_loop = deepCopy (for_loop);
    1987           0 :   SgWhileStmt* w_stmt = buildWhileStmt (func_call_exp, new_loop);
    1988           0 :   appendStatement (w_stmt, bb1);
    1989             : //  moveStatementsBetweenBlocks (loop_body, isSgBasicBlock(w_stmt->get_body()));
    1990             : 
    1991             :   // rewrite upper, lower bounds, TODO how about step? normalized to 1 already ?
    1992           0 :   setLoopLowerBound (new_loop, buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_lower_decl)));
    1993           0 :   setLoopUpperBound (new_loop, buildVarRefExp (getFirstVarSym(dev_upper_decl)));
    1994           0 :   removeStatement (for_loop);
    1995             : 
    1996             :   // handle private variables at this loop level, mostly loop index variables.
    1997             :   // TODO: this is not very elegant since the outer most loop's loop variable is still translated.
    1998             :   //for reduction
    1999           0 :   per_block_declarations.clear(); // must reset to empty or wrong reference to stale content generated previously
    2000           0 :   transOmpVariables(target, bb1,NULL, true);
    2001           0 : }
    2002             : 
    2003             : 
    2004             :   //! Check if an OpenMP statement has a clause of type vt
    2005           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> getClause(SgStatement* clause_stmt, const VariantT & vt)
    2006             :   {
    2007           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(clause_stmt != NULL);
    2008           0 :     SgOmpClausePtrList clauses;
    2009           0 :     if (isSgUpirFieldBodyStatement(clause_stmt)) {
    2010           0 :         clauses = (isSgUpirFieldBodyStatement(clause_stmt))->get_clauses();
    2011             :     }
    2012           0 :     else if (isSgUpirFieldStatement(clause_stmt)) {
    2013           0 :         clauses = (isSgUpirFieldStatement(clause_stmt))->get_clauses();
    2014             :     }
    2015             :     else {
    2016           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(0);
    2017           0 :     };
    2018           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> p_clause =
    2019           0 :       NodeQuery::queryNodeList<SgOmpClause>(clauses,vt);
    2020           0 :     return p_clause;
    2021             :   }
    2022             : 
    2023             :   //! Check if an OpenMP statement has a clause of type vt
    2024           0 :   bool hasClause(SgStatement* clause_stmt, const VariantT & vt)
    2025             :   {
    2026           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(clause_stmt != NULL);
    2027           0 :     SgOmpClausePtrList clauses;
    2028           0 :     if (isSgUpirFieldBodyStatement(clause_stmt)) {
    2029           0 :         clauses = (isSgUpirFieldBodyStatement(clause_stmt))->get_clauses();
    2030             :     }
    2031           0 :     else if (isSgUpirFieldStatement(clause_stmt)) {
    2032           0 :         clauses = (isSgUpirFieldStatement(clause_stmt))->get_clauses();
    2033             :     }
    2034             :     else {
    2035           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(0);
    2036           0 :     };
    2037           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> p_clause =
    2038           0 :       NodeQuery::queryNodeList<SgOmpClause>(clauses,vt);
    2039           0 :     return (p_clause.size()!= 0);
    2040             :   }
    2041             : 
    2042             : //! A helper function to generate implicit or explicit task for either omp parallel or omp task
    2043             : //  Parameters:  SgNode* node: the OMP Parallel or OMP Parallel
    2044             : //               std::string& wrapper_name: for C/C++, structure wrapper is used to wrap all parameters. This is to return the struct name
    2045             : //               ASTtools::VarSymSet_t& syms :  all variables to be passed in/out the outlined function
    2046             : //               ASTtools::VarSymSet_t&pdSyms3 : variables which must be passed by references, used to guide the creation of struct wrapper: member using base type vs. using pointer type.  The algorithm to generate this set is already very conservative: after transOmpVariables() , the only exclude firstprivate. In the context of OpenMP, it is equivalent to say this is a set of variables which are to be passed by references.
    2047             : // Algorithms:
    2048             : //    Set flags of the outliner to indicate desired behaviors: parameter wrapping or not?
    2049             : //    translate OpenMP variables (first private, private, reduction, etc) so the code to be outlined is already as simple as possible (without OpenMP-specific semantics)
    2050             : //
    2051             : // It calls the ROSE AST outliner internally.
    2052           0 : SgFunctionDeclaration* generateOutlinedTask(SgNode* node, std::string& wrapper_name,
    2053             :                                             ASTtools::VarSymSet_t& syms,
    2054             :                                             ASTtools::VarSymSet_t&pdSyms3,
    2055             :                                             bool use_task_param)
    2056             : {
    2057           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL);
    2058           0 :   SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* target = isSgUpirFieldBodyStatement(node);
    2059           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (target != NULL);
    2060             : 
    2061             :   // must be either omp task or omp parallel
    2062           0 :   SgOmpTaskStatement* target1 = isSgOmpTaskStatement(node);
    2063           0 :   SgUpirSpmdStatement* target2 = isSgUpirSpmdStatement(node);
    2064           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (target1 != NULL || target2 != NULL);
    2065             : 
    2066           0 :   SgStatement * body =  target->get_body();
    2067           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(body != NULL);
    2068           0 :   SgFunctionDeclaration* result= NULL;
    2069             :   //Initialize outliner
    2070           0 :   Outliner::enable_classic = false; // we need use parameter wrapping, which is not classic behavior of outlining
    2071             :   // We pass one variable per parameter, at least for Fortran 77.
    2072             :   // For both C/C++ and Fortran, we use the same method to pass parameters separately instead of a struct or array wrapper.
    2073           0 :   Outliner::useParameterWrapper = false;
    2074             : 
    2075             :   //TODO there should be some semantics check for the regions to be outlined
    2076             :   //for example, multiple entries or exists are not allowed for OpenMP
    2077             :   //This is however of low priority since most vendor compilers have this already.
    2078           0 :   SgBasicBlock* body_block = Outliner::preprocess(body);
    2079             : 
    2080             :   //---------------------------------------------------------------
    2081             :   //  Key step: handling special variables BEFORE actual outlining is done!!
    2082             :   // Variable handling is done after Outliner::preprocess() to ensure a basic block for the body,
    2083             :   // but before calling the actual outlining
    2084             :   // This simplifies the outlining since firstprivate, private variables are replaced
    2085             :   //with their local copies before outliner is used

    2087             :

    2145             :   // lastprivate and reduction variables cannot be excluded  since write access to their shared copies
    2146             : 
    2147             :   // Sara Royuela 24/04/2012
    2148             :   // When unpacking array variables in the outlined function, it is needed to have access to the size of the array.
    2149             :   // When this size is a variable (or a operation containing variables), this variable must be added to the arguments of the outlined function.
    2150             :   // Example:
    2151             :   //    Input snippet:                      Outlined function:
    2152             :   //        int N = 1;                          static void OUT__1__5493__(void *__out_argv) {
    2153             :   //        int a[N];                               int (*a)[N] = (int (*)[N])(((struct OUT__1__5493___data *)__out_argv) -> a_p);
    2154             :   //        #pragma omp task shared(a)              ( *a)[0] = 1;
    2155             :   //            a[0] = 1;                       }
    2156           0 :   ASTtools::VarSymSet_t new_syms;

    2158             :   {
    2159           0 :     SgType* i_type = (*i)->get_declaration()->get_type();
    2160             : 
    2161           0 :     while (isSgArrayType(i_type))
    2162             :     {
    2163             :       // Get most significant dimension
    2164           0 :       SgExpression* index = ((SgArrayType*) i_type)->get_index();
    2165             :

    2172           0 :       Outliner::collectVars(index_stmt, a_syms);
    2173           0 :       SageInterface::removeStatement(index_stmt);

    2177           0 :         new_syms.insert(s);   // If the symbol is not in the symbol list, it is added
    2178             :       }

    2294             : #if 0 // Moved to SageInterface
    2295             : //! iterate through the statement within a scope, find the last declaration statement (if any) after which
    2296             : //  another declaration statement can be inserted.
    2297             : // This is useful to find a safe place to insert a declaration statement with special requirements about where it can be inserted.
    2298             : // e.g. a variable declaration statement should not be inserted before IMPLICIT none in Fortran
    2299             : // If it returns NULL, a declaration statement should be able to be prepended to the scope
    2300             : static SgStatement* findLastDeclarationStatement(SgScopeStatement * scope)
    2301             : {
    2302             :   SgStatement* rt = NULL;
    2303             :   ROSE_ASSERT (scope != NULL);
    2304             : 
    2305             :   SgStatementPtrList stmt_list = scope->generateStatementList ();

    2364           0 :   void transOmpParallel (SgNode* node)

    2478           0 :     if (omp_num_threads != NULL) {

    2776             : //TODO move to SageInterface
    2777             : // Liao 2/8/2013
    2778             : // rewrite array reference using multiple-dimension subscripts to a reference using one-dimension subscripts
    2779             : // e.g. a[i][j] is changed to a[i*col_size +j]
    2780             : //      a [i][j][k]  is changed to a [(i*col_size + j)*K_size +k]
    2781             : // The parameter is the array reference expression to be changed
    2782             : // Note the array reference expression must be the top one since there will be inner ones for a multi-dimensional array references in AST.
    2783           0 : static void linearizeArrayAccess(SgPntrArrRefExp* top_array_ref)
    2784             : {
    2785             :   //Sanity check
    2786             :   // TODO check language compatibility for C/C++ only: row major storage
    2787           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT( top_array_ref != NULL);
    2788             :   //ROSE_ASSERT (top_array_ref->get_lhs_operand_i() != NULL);
    2789           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (top_array_ref->get_parent() != NULL );

    2791             : 
    2792             :   // must be a canonical array reference, not like (a+10)[10]
    2793           0 :   SgExpression* arrayNameExp = NULL;
    2794           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression*>* subscripts = new vector<SgExpression*>;
    2795           0 :   bool is_array_ref = isArrayReference (top_array_ref, &arrayNameExp, &subscripts);
    2796           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (is_array_ref);
    2797           0 :   SgInitializedName * i_name = convertRefToInitializedName(arrayNameExp);
    2798           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (i_name != NULL);
    2799           0 :   SgType* var_type = i_name->get_type();
    2800           0 :   SgArrayType * array_type = isSgArrayType(var_type);
    2801           0 :   SgPointerType * pointer_type = isSgPointerType(var_type);
    2802             :   // pointer type can also be used as pointer[i], which is represented as SgPntrArrRefExp.
    2803             :   // In this case, we don't need to linearized it any more
    2804           0 :   if (pointer_type != NULL)
    2805           0 :      return;
    2806           0 :   if (array_type == NULL)
    2807             :   {
    2808           0 :     cerr<<"Error. linearizeArrayAccess() found unhandled variable type:"<<var_type->class_name()<<endl;
    2809             :   }
    2810             : 
    2811           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (array_type!= NULL);
    2812             :
