    2815             : 
    2816           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT ((*subscripts).size() == dimensions.size());
    2817           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT ((*subscripts).size()>1); // we only accept 2-D or above for processing. Caller should check this in advance
    2818             : 
    2819             :   // left hand operand
    2820           0 :   SgExpression* new_lhs = buildVarRefExp(i_name);
    2821           0 :   SgExpression* new_rhs = deepCopy((*subscripts)[0]); //initialized to be i;
    2822             : 
    2823             :   // build rhs, like (i*col_size + j)*K_size +k
    2824           0 :   for (size_t i =1; i<dimensions.size(); i++) // only repeat dimension count -1 times
    2825             :   {
    2826           0 :      new_rhs = buildAddOp( buildMultiplyOp(new_rhs, deepCopy(dimensions[i]) ) , deepCopy((*subscripts)[i]) ) ;
    2827             :   }
    2828             : 
    2829             :   // set new lhs and rhs for the top ref
    2830           0 :   deepDelete(top_array_ref->get_lhs_operand_i()) ;
    2831           0 :   deepDelete(top_array_ref->get_rhs_operand_i()) ;
    2832             : 
    2833           0 :   top_array_ref->set_lhs_operand_i(new_lhs);
    2834           0 :   new_lhs->set_parent(top_array_ref);
    2835             : 
    2836           0 :   top_array_ref->set_rhs_operand_i(new_rhs);
    2837           0 :   new_rhs->set_parent(top_array_ref);
    2838             : 
    2839             : }
    2840             : 
    2841             : 
    2842             : // Find all top level array references within the body block,
    2843             : // we do the following:
    2844             : //   if it is within the set of arrays (array_syms) to be rewritten: arrays on map() clause,
    2845             : //   if it is more than 1-D
    2846             : //   change it to be linearized subscript access
    2847           0 : static void rewriteArraySubscripts(SgBasicBlock* body_block, const std::set<SgSymbol*> mapped_array_syms)
    2848             : {
    2849           0 :   std::vector<SgPntrArrRefExp* > candidate_refs; // store eligible references
    2850           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgNode*> nodeList = NodeQuery::querySubTree(body_block, V_SgPntrArrRefExp);
    2851           0 :   for (Rose_STL_Container<SgNode *>::iterator i = nodeList.begin(); i != nodeList.end(); i++)
    2852             :   {
    2853           0 :     SgPntrArrRefExp* vRef = isSgPntrArrRefExp((*i));
    2854           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (vRef != NULL);
    2855           0 :     SgNode* parent = vRef->get_parent();
    2856             :     // if it is top level ref?
    2857           0 :     if (isSgPntrArrRefExp(parent)) // has a higher level array ref, skip it
    2858           0 :       continue;
    2859             :    //TODO: move this logic into a function in SageInterface
    2860             :     // If it is a canonical array reference we can handle?
    2861           0 :     vector<SgExpression *>  *subscripts = new vector<SgExpression*>;
    2862           0 :     SgExpression* array_name_exp = NULL;
    2863           0 :     isArrayReference(vRef, &array_name_exp, &subscripts);
    2864           0 :     SgInitializedName* a_name = convertRefToInitializedName (array_name_exp);
    2865           0 :     if  (a_name == NULL)
    2866           0 :       continue;
    2867             :     // if it is within the mapped array set?

    2907             : // find different map clauses from the clause list, and all array information
    2908             : // dimension map is the same for all the map clauses under the same omp target directive
    2909           0 : void extractMapClauses(Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> map_clauses,
    2910             :     std::map<SgSymbol*, std::vector< std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > > & array_dimensions,

    2949             : static int generate_mapping_variable_type (

    2969             :         type_value = type_value | OMP_TGT_MAPTYPE_TO;
    2970             :     };

    2972             :     if (needCopyFrom) {
    2973             :         type_value = type_value | OMP_TGT_MAPTYPE_FROM;
    2974             :     };
    2975             :

    2977             : }
    2978             : 
    2979             : // Translated a single mapped array variable, knowing the map clauses , where to insert, etc.
    2980             : // Only generate memory allocation, deallocation, copy, functions, not the declaration since decl involves too many variable bookkeeping.
    2981             : // This is intended to be called by a for loop going through all mapped array variables.
    2982             :   //  Essentially, we have to decide if we need to do the following steps for each variable
    2983             :   //
    2984             :   //  Data handling: declaration, allocation, and copy
    2985             :   //    1. declared a pointer type to the device copy : pass by pointer type vs. pass by value
    2986             :   //    2. allocate device copy using the dimension bound info: for array types (pointers used for linearized arrays)
    2987             :   //    3. copy the data from CPU to the device (GPU) copy:
    2988             :   //
    2989             :   //    4. replace references to the CPU copies with references to the GPU copy
    2990             :   //    5. replace original multidimensional element indexing with linearized address indexing (for 2-D and more dimension arrays)
    2991             :   //
    2992             :   //  Data handling: copy back, de-allocation
    2993             :   //    6. copy GPU_copy back to CPU variables
    2994             :   //    7. de-allocate the GPU variables
    2995             :   //
    2996             :   //   Step 1,2,3 and 6, 7 should generate statements before or after the SgUpirTaskStatement
    2997             :   //   Step 4 and 5 should change the body of the affected SgUpirSpmdStatement
    2998             :   // Revised Algorithm (version 3)    1/23/2015, optionally use device data environment (DDE) functions to manage data automatically.
    2999             :   // Instead of generate explicit data allocation, copy, free functions, using the following three DDE functions:
    3000             :   //   1. xomp_deviceDataEnvironmentEnter()
    3001             :   //   2. xomp_deviceDataEnvironmentPrepareVariable ()
    3002             :   //   3. xomp_deviceDataEnvironmentExit()
    3003             :   // This is necessary to have a consistent translation for mapped data showing up in both "target data" and "target" directives.
    3004             :   // These DDE functions internally will keep track of data allocated and try to reuse enclosing data environment.
    3005           0 : static void generateMappedArrayMemoryHandling(
    3006             :     /* the array and the map information */
    3007             :     SgSymbol* sym,
    3008             :     SgOmpMapClause* map_alloc_clause, SgOmpMapClause* map_to_clause, SgOmpMapClause* map_from_clause, SgOmpMapClause* map_tofrom_clause,
    3009             :     std::map<SgSymbol*,  std::vector < std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > > & array_dimensions, SgExpression* device_expression,
    3010             :     /*Where to insert generated function calls*/
    3011             :     SgBasicBlock* insertion_scope, SgStatement* insertion_anchor_stmt,
    3012             :     bool need_generate_data_stmt,
    3013             :     std::vector<SgExpression* >* map_variable_list, std::vector<SgExpression* >* map_variable_base_list, std::vector<SgExpression* >* map_variable_size_list, std::vector<SgExpression* >* map_variable_type_list
    3014             :     )
    3015             : {
    3016           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (sym != NULL);

    3247             :   { // or explicitly control copy back and deallocation
    3248             :     // Step 6. copy back data from GPU to CPU, only for variable in map(out:var_list)
    3249             :     // e.g. xomp_memcpyDeviceToHost ((void*)c, (const void*)dev_m3, array_size);
    3250             :     // Note: insert this AFTER the target directive stmt
    3251             :     // SgStatement* prev_stmt = target_parallel_stmt;
    3252           0 :     if (needCopyFrom)
    3253             :     {
    3254           0 :       SgExprListExp * parameters = buildExprListExp (
    3255           0 :           buildCastExp(buildVarRefExp(orig_name, insertion_scope), buildPointerType(buildVoidType()) ),
    3256           0 :           buildCastExp(buildVarRefExp(dev_var_name, insertion_scope), buildPointerType(buildConstType(buildVoidType()))),
    3257           0 :           buildVarRefExp( dev_var_size_name, insertion_scope)
    3258             :           );
    3259           0 :       SgExprStatement* mem_copy_back_stmt = buildFunctionCallStmt (SgName("xomp_memcpyDeviceToHost"),
    3260           0 :           buildPointerType(buildVoidType()),
    3261             :           parameters,
    3262             :           insertion_scope);
    3263           0 :       appendStatement(mem_copy_back_stmt, insertion_anchor_stmt->get_scope());
    3264             :       // prev_stmt = mem_copy_back_stmt;
    3265             :     }
    3266             : 
    3267             :     // Step 7, de-allocate GPU memory
    3268             :     // e.g. xomp_freeDevice(dev_m1);
    3269             :     // Note: insert this AFTER the target directive stmt or the copy back stmt
    3270           0 :     SgExprStatement* mem_dealloc_stmt =
    3271           0 :       buildFunctionCallStmt(SgName("xomp_freeDevice"),
    3272           0 :           buildBoolType(),
    3273           0 :           buildExprListExp(buildVarRefExp( dev_var_name,insertion_scope)),
    3274             :           insertion_scope);
    3275           0 :     appendStatement(mem_dealloc_stmt, insertion_anchor_stmt->get_scope());
    3276             :   }
    3277             : 
    3278             :     // check the type of current array symbol and calculate the desired data size
    3279           0 :     SgExpression* mapping_variable_expression = NULL;
    3280           0 :     mapping_variable_expression = buildVarRefExp(sym->get_name(), sym->get_scope());
    3281           0 :     map_variable_list->push_back(buildAddOp(mapping_variable_expression, mapping_array_offset));
    3282           0 :     map_variable_base_list->push_back(mapping_variable_expression);
    3283           0 :     SgExpression* mapping_variable_total_size = buildCastExp(buildMultiplyOp(buildSizeOfOp(element_type), mapping_array_size), buildOpaqueType("int64_t", insertion_scope));
    3284           0 :     map_variable_size_list->push_back(mapping_variable_total_size);
    3285             : 
    3286           0 :     int mapping_variable_type_enum = generate_mapping_variable_type(sym, map_alloc_clause, map_to_clause, map_from_clause, map_tofrom_clause,array_dimensions, device_expression,
    3287             :     insertion_scope, insertion_anchor_stmt);
    3288           0 :     SgExpression* mapping_variable_value = buildIntVal(mapping_variable_type_enum);
    3289           0 :     map_variable_type_list->push_back(mapping_variable_value);
    3290             : }
    3291             : 
    3292             : // trans OpenMP map variables
    3293             : // return all generated or remaining variables to be passed to the outliner
    3294             :   // Liao, 2/4/2013
    3295             :   // Translate the map clause variables associated with "omp target parallel"
    3296             :   // We only support combined "target parallel" or "parallel" immediately following "target"
    3297             :   // So we handle outlining and data handling for two directives at the same time
    3298             :   // TODO: move to the header
    3299             :   // Input:
    3300             :   //
    3301             :   //  map(alloc|to|from|tofrom:var_list)
    3302             :   //  array variable in var_list should have dimension bounds information like [0:N-1][0:K-1]
    3303             :   //
    3304             :   //  Essentially, we have to decide if we need to do the following steps for each variable
    3305             :   //
    3306             :   //  Data handling: declaration, allocation, and copy
    3307             :   //    1. declared a pointer type to the device copy : pass by pointer type vs. pass by value
    3308             :   //    2. allocate device copy using the dimension bound info: for array types (pointers used for linearized arrays)
    3309             :   //    3. copy the data from CPU to the device (GPU) copy:
    3310             :   //
    3311             :   //    4. replace references to the CPU copies with references to the GPU copy
    3312             :   //    5. replace original multidimensional element indexing with linearized address indexing (for 2-D and more dimension arrays)
    3313             :   //
    3314             :   //  Data handling: copy back, de-allocation
    3315             :   //    6. copy GPU_copy back to CPU variables
    3316             :   //    7. de-allocate the GPU variables
    3317             :   //
    3318             :   //   Step 1,2,3 and 6, 7 should generate statements before or after the SgUpirTaskStatement
    3319             :   //   Step 4 and 5 should change the body of the affected SgUpirSpmdStatement
    3320             :   //
    3321             :   //  Algorithm 1:
    3322             :   //   collect all variables in map clauses: they should be either scalar or arrays with bound info.
    3323             :   //   For each array variable,
    3324             :   //       we generate memory handling statements for them: declaration, allocation, copy back-forth, de-allocation
    3325             :   //   For the use of array variable,
    3326             :   //       we replace the original references with references to new pointer typed variables
    3327             :   //       Linearize the access when 2-D or more dimensions are used.
    3328             :   //
    3329             :   //   Based on the mapped variables, we output the variables to be passed to the outlined function to be generated later on
    3330             :   //         variables which will be passed by their original data types
    3331             :   //         variables which will be passed by their address of type: pointer type pointing to their original data type
    3332             :   //
    3333             :   //  Revised Algorithm (version 2):  To translate "omp target" + "omp parallel for" enclosed within "omp target data" region:
    3334             :   //  New facts:
    3335             :   //        the map clauses are now associated with "omp target data" instead of "omp target"
    3336             :   //        Only a subset of all mapped variables at "omp target data" level will be used within "omp target":
    3337             :   //           a single data region contains multiple "omp target" regions
    3338             :   //        When translating "omp target" + "omp parallel for", we don't need to generate data handling statements
    3339             :   //            but we need to refer to the declarations for device variables.
    3340             :   //        Memory declaration, allocation, copy back-forth, de-allocation is generated within the body of the "omp target data" region.
    3341             :   //            we can still try to generate them when translating "omp parallel for" under "omp target", if not yet generated before.
    3342             :   //
    3343             :   // Revised Algorithm (V3): using Device Data Environment (DDE) runtime support to manage nested data regions
    3344             :   //       To simplify the handling, we assume
    3345             :   //         1. Both "target data"  and "target parallel for " should have map() clauses
    3346             :   //         2. Using DDE, the translation is simplified as is identical for both directive
    3347           0 : ASTtools::VarSymSet_t transOmpMapVariables(SgStatement* target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt, SgExprListExp* map_variable_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_base_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_size_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_type_list  // either "target data" or "target parallel" statement
    3348             :                    )
    3349             : {
    3350           0 :   ASTtools::VarSymSet_t all_syms;
    3351           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT  (target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt !=NULL);
    3352           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT  (all_syms.size() == 0); // it should be empty
    3353             : 
    3354           0 :   SgUpirSpmdStatement* target_parallel_stmt = NULL;
    3355           0 :   SgUpirTaskStatement* target_directive_stmt = NULL;
    3356           0 :   SgOmpTargetDataStatement * target_data_stmt = NULL;
    3357           0 :   SgOmpTargetParallelForStatement* target_parallel_for_stmt = NULL;
    3358           0 :   SgOmpTargetTeamsDistributeParallelForStatement* target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt = NULL;
    3359             : 
    3360           0 :   target_parallel_stmt = isSgUpirSpmdStatement(target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt);
    3361           0 :   target_data_stmt = isSgOmpTargetDataStatement(target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt);
    3362           0 :   target_parallel_for_stmt = isSgOmpTargetParallelForStatement(target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt);
    3363           0 :   target_directive_stmt = isSgUpirTaskStatement(target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt);
    3364           0 :   target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt = isSgOmpTargetTeamsDistributeParallelForStatement(target_data_or_target_parallel_stmt);
    3365             : 
    3366             :   // the parallel directive must be combined with target directive
    3367           0 :   if (target_parallel_stmt != NULL)
    3368             :   {
    3369             :    // must be a parallel region directly under "omp target"
    3370           0 :     SgNode* parent = target_parallel_stmt->get_parent();
    3371           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (parent != NULL);
    3372           0 :    if (isSgBasicBlock(parent)) //skip the possible block in between
    3373           0 :       parent = parent->get_parent();
    3374           0 :     target_directive_stmt = isSgUpirTaskStatement(parent);
    3375           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (target_directive_stmt != NULL);
    3376             :   }
    3377             : 
    3378             :   // collect map clauses and their variables
    3379             :   // ----------------------------------------------------------
    3380             :   // Some notes for the relevant AST input:
    3381             :   // we store a map clause for each variant/operator (alloc, to, from, and tofrom), so there should be up to 4 SgOmpMapClause.
    3382             :   //    SgOmpClause::omp_map_operator_enum
    3383             :   // each map clause has
    3384             :   //   a variable list (SgVarRefExp), accessible through get_variables()
    3385             :   //   a pointer to array_dimensions, accessible through get_array_dimensions(). the array_dimensions is identical among all map clause of a same "omp target"
    3386             :   //     std::map<SgSymbol*,  std::vector < std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > >  array_dimensions
    3387             : 
    3388           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> map_clauses;
    3389           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> device_clauses;
    3390           0 :   if (target_data_stmt)
    3391             :   {
    3392           0 :      map_clauses = getClause(target_data_stmt, V_SgOmpMapClause);
    3393           0 :      device_clauses = getClause(target_data_stmt, V_SgOmpDeviceClause);
    3394             :   }
    3395           0 :   else if (target_directive_stmt)
    3396             :   {
    3397           0 :      map_clauses = getClause(target_directive_stmt, V_SgOmpMapClause);
    3398           0 :      device_clauses = getClause(target_directive_stmt, V_SgOmpDeviceClause);
    3399             :   }
    3400           0 :   else if (target_parallel_for_stmt)
    3401             :   {
    3402           0 :      map_clauses = getClause(target_parallel_for_stmt, V_SgOmpMapClause);
    3403           0 :      device_clauses = getClause(target_parallel_for_stmt, V_SgOmpDeviceClause);
    3404             :   }
    3405           0 :   else if (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt)
    3406             :   {
    3407           0 :      map_clauses = getClause(target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt, V_SgOmpMapClause);
    3408           0 :      device_clauses = getClause(target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt, V_SgOmpDeviceClause);
    3409             :   }
    3410             :   else
    3411           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (false);
    3412             : 
    3413           0 :   if ( map_clauses.size() == 0) return all_syms; // stop if no map clauses at all
    3414             : 
    3415             :   // store each time of map clause explicitly
    3416           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_alloc_clause = NULL;
    3417           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_to_clause = NULL;
    3418           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_from_clause = NULL;
    3419           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_tofrom_clause = NULL;
    3420             :   // dimension map is the same for all the map clauses under the same omp target directive
    3421           0 :   std::map<SgSymbol*,  std::vector < std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > >  array_dimensions;
    3422           0 :   std::map<SgSymbol*, std::vector< std::pair< SgOmpClause::omp_map_dist_data_enum, SgExpression * > > > dist_data_policies; // no in use, for compatible reason
    3423             : 
    3424             :   // a map between original symbol and its device version : used for variable replacement
    3425           0 :   std::map <SgVariableSymbol*, SgVariableSymbol*>  cpu_gpu_var_map;
    3426             : 
    3427             :   // store all variables showing up in any of the map clauses
    3428           0 :   SgInitializedNamePtrList all_mapped_vars ;
    3429           0 :   if (target_data_stmt)
    3430           0 :     all_mapped_vars = collectClauseVariables (target_data_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpMapClause));
    3431           0 :   else if (target_directive_stmt)
    3432           0 :     all_mapped_vars = collectClauseVariables (target_directive_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpMapClause));
    3433           0 :   else if (target_parallel_for_stmt)
    3434           0 :     all_mapped_vars = collectClauseVariables (target_parallel_for_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpMapClause));
    3435           0 :   else if (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt)
    3436           0 :     all_mapped_vars = collectClauseVariables (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpMapClause));
    3437             : 
    3438             :   // store all variables showing up in any of the device clauses
    3439           0 :   SgExpression* device_expression = NULL;
    3440           0 :   if (target_data_stmt)
    3441           0 :     device_expression = getClauseExpression (target_data_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpDeviceClause));
    3442           0 :   else if (target_directive_stmt)
    3443           0 :     device_expression = getClauseExpression (target_directive_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpDeviceClause));
    3444           0 :   else if (target_parallel_for_stmt)
    3445           0 :     device_expression = getClauseExpression (target_parallel_for_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpDeviceClause));
    3446           0 :   else if (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt)
    3447           0 :     device_expression = getClauseExpression (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt, VariantVector(V_SgOmpDeviceClause));
    3448             : 
    3449             : 
    3450           0 :   extractMapClauses (map_clauses, array_dimensions, dist_data_policies, &map_alloc_clause, &map_to_clause, &map_from_clause, &map_tofrom_clause);
    3451           0 :   std::set<SgSymbol*> array_syms; // store clause variable symbols which are array types (explicit or as a pointer)
    3452           0 :   std::set<SgSymbol*> atom_syms; // store clause variable symbols which are non-aggregate types: scalar, pointer, etc
    3453             : 
    3454             :   // categorize the variables:
    3455           0 :   categorizeMapClauseVariables (all_mapped_vars, array_dimensions, array_syms, atom_syms);
    3456             : 
    3457             :   // set the scope and anchor statement we will focus on based on the availability of an enclosing target data region
    3458           0 :   SgBasicBlock* insertion_scope = NULL; // the body
    3459           0 :   SgStatement* insertion_anchor_stmt = NULL; // the single statement within the body
    3460           0 :  if (target_data_stmt != NULL)
    3461             :  {
    3462             :    // at this point, the body should already be normalized to be a BB
    3463           0 :    SgBasicBlock * body_block = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfOmpBodyStmt(target_data_stmt);
    3464           0 :    ROSE_ASSERT (body_block!= NULL);
    3465             : 
    3466           0 :    SgStatement* target_data_child_stmt = NULL;
    3467             :    // We cannot assert this since the body of "omp target data" may already be expanded as part of a previous translation
    3468             :    //    ROSE_ASSERT( (target_data_stmt_body->get_statements()).size() ==1);
    3469           0 :    target_data_child_stmt = (body_block->get_statements())[0];
    3470             : 
    3471           0 :    insertion_scope = body_block;
    3472           0 :    insertion_anchor_stmt = target_data_child_stmt;
    3473             :  }
    3474           0 :   else if (target_directive_stmt != NULL)
    3475             :   {
    3476           0 :    insertion_scope = isSgBasicBlock(target_directive_stmt->get_scope());
    3477             :    insertion_anchor_stmt = target_directive_stmt;
    3478             :   }
    3479           0 :   else if (target_parallel_for_stmt != NULL)
    3480             :   {
    3481             :    // at this point, the body should already be normalized to be a BB
    3482           0 :    SgBasicBlock * body_block = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfOmpBodyStmt(target_parallel_for_stmt);
    3483           0 :    ROSE_ASSERT (body_block!= NULL);
    3484             : 
    3485           0 :    SgStatement* target_data_child_stmt = NULL;
    3486             :    // We cannot assert this since the body of "omp target data" may already be expanded as part of a previous translation
    3487             :    //    ROSE_ASSERT( (target_data_stmt_body->get_statements()).size() ==1);
    3488           0 :    target_data_child_stmt = (body_block->get_statements())[0];
    3489             : 
    3490           0 :    insertion_scope = body_block;
    3491           0 :    insertion_anchor_stmt = target_data_child_stmt;
    3492             :   }
    3493           0 :   else if (target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt != NULL)
    3494             :   {
    3495             :    // at this point, the body should already be normalized to be a BB
    3496           0 :    SgBasicBlock * body_block = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfOmpBodyStmt(target_teams_distribute_parallel_for_stmt);
    3497           0 :    ROSE_ASSERT (body_block!= NULL);
    3498             : 
    3499           0 :    SgStatement* target_data_child_stmt = NULL;
    3500             :    // We cannot assert this since the body of "omp target data" may already be expanded as part of a previous translation
    3501             :    //    ROSE_ASSERT( (target_data_stmt_body->get_statements()).size() ==1);
    3502           0 :    target_data_child_stmt = (body_block->get_statements())[0];
    3503             : 
    3504           0 :    insertion_scope = body_block;
    3505           0 :    insertion_anchor_stmt = target_data_child_stmt;
    3506             :   }
    3507           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (insertion_scope != NULL);
    3508           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (insertion_anchor_stmt != NULL);
    3509             : 
    3510             :   // collect used variables in the insertion scope
    3511           0 :   std::map <SgVariableSymbol *, bool> variable_map = collectVariableAppearance (insertion_scope);
    3512             : 
    3513           0 :   if (device_expression == NULL) {
    3514           0 :     device_expression = buildIntVal(0);
    3515           0 :   };
    3516             : 
    3517           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression* >* mapping_array_list = new std::vector<SgExpression* >();
    3518           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression* >* mapping_array_base_list = new std::vector<SgExpression* >();
    3519           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression* >* mapping_array_size_list = new std::vector<SgExpression* >();
    3520           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression* >* mapping_array_type_list = new std::vector<SgExpression* >();
    3521             :   // handle array variables showing up in the map clauses:
    3522           0 :   for (std::set<SgSymbol*>::const_iterator iter = array_syms.begin(); iter != array_syms.end(); iter ++)
    3523             :   {
    3524           0 :     SgSymbol* sym = *iter;
    3525           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (sym != NULL);
    3526           0 :     SgType* orig_type = sym->get_type();
    3527             : 
    3528             :     // Step 1: declare a pointer type to array variables in map clauses, we linearize all arrays to be a 1-D pointer
    3529             :     //   Element_type * _dev_var;
    3530             :     //   e.g.: double* _dev_array;
    3531             :     // I believe that all array variables need allocations on GPUs, regardless their map operations (alloc, to, from, or tofrom)
    3532             : 
    3533             :     // TODO: is this a safe assumption here??
    3534           0 :     SgType* element_type = orig_type->findBaseType(); // recursively strip away non-base type to get the bottom type
    3535           0 :     string orig_name = (sym->get_name()).getString();
    3536           0 :     string dev_var_name = "_dev_"+ orig_name;
    3537             : 
    3538           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* dev_var_decl = NULL;
    3539           0 :     dev_var_decl = buildVariableDeclaration(dev_var_name, buildPointerType(element_type), NULL, insertion_scope);
    3540           0 :     insertStatementBefore (insertion_anchor_stmt, dev_var_decl);
    3541           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (dev_var_decl != NULL);
    3542             : 
    3543           0 :     SgVariableSymbol* orig_sym = isSgVariableSymbol(sym);
    3544           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (orig_sym != NULL);
    3545           0 :     SgVariableSymbol* new_sym = getFirstVarSym(dev_var_decl);
    3546           0 :     cpu_gpu_var_map[orig_sym]= new_sym; // store the mapping, this is always needed to guide the outlining
    3547             : 
    3548             :     // Not all map variables from "omp target data" will be used within the current parallel region
    3549             :     // We only need to find out the used one only.
    3550             : 
    3551             :     // linearized array pointers should be directly passed to the outliner later on, without adding & operator in front of them
    3552             :     // we assume AST is normalized and all target regions have explicit and correct map() clauses
    3553             :     // Still some transformation like loop collapse will change the variables
    3554           0 :         if (variable_map[orig_sym])
    3555           0 :           all_syms.insert(new_sym);
    3556             :     // generate memory allocation, copy, free function calls.
    3557           0 :     generateMappedArrayMemoryHandling (sym, map_alloc_clause, map_to_clause, map_from_clause, map_tofrom_clause,array_dimensions, device_expression,
    3558             :         insertion_scope, insertion_anchor_stmt, true, mapping_array_list, mapping_array_base_list, mapping_array_size_list, mapping_array_type_list);
    3559             :   }  // end for
    3560             : 
    3561             :   // Step 5. TODO  replace indexing element access with address calculation (only needed for 2/3 -D)
    3562             :   // We switch the order of 4 and 5 since we want to rewrite the subscripts before the arrays are replaced
    3563           0 :   rewriteArraySubscripts (insertion_scope, array_syms);
    3564             : 
    3565             :   // Step 4. replace references to old with new variables,
    3566           0 :   replaceVariableReferences (insertion_scope , cpu_gpu_var_map);
    3567             : 
    3568             :   // TODO handle scalar, separate or merged into previous loop ?
    3569             : 
    3570             :   // store remaining variables so outliner can readily use this information
    3571             :   // for pointers to linearized arrays, they should passed by their original form, not using & operator, regardless the map operator types (to|from|alloc|tofrom)
    3572             :   // for a scalar, two cases: to vs. from | tofrom
    3573             :   // if in only, pass by value is good
    3574             :   // if either from or tofrom:
    3575             :   // two possible solutions:
    3576             :   // 1) we need to treat it as an array of size 1 or any other choices. TODO!!
    3577             :   //  we also have to replace the reference to scalar to the array element access: be cautious about using by value (a) vs. using by address  (&a)
    3578             :   // 2) try to still pass by value, but copy the final value back to the CPU version
    3579             :   // right now we assume they are not on from|tofrom, until we face a real input applications with map(from:scalar_a)
    3580             :   // For all scalars, we directly copy them into all_syms for now
    3581           0 :   for (std::set<SgSymbol*> ::iterator iter = atom_syms.begin(); iter != atom_syms.end(); iter ++)
    3582             :   {
    3583           0 :     SgVariableSymbol * var_sym = isSgVariableSymbol(*iter);
    3584           0 :     if (variable_map[var_sym] == true) // we should only collect map variables which show up in the current parallel region
    3585           0 :       all_syms.insert (var_sym);
    3586             : 
    3587             :     // check the type of current variable symbol and calculate its size
    3588           0 :     if (variable_map[var_sym] == true) {
    3589           0 :         SgInitializedName* mapping_variable = var_sym->get_declaration();
    3590           0 :         SgType* mapping_variable_type = mapping_variable->get_type();
    3591           0 :         SgExpression* mapping_variable_expression = NULL;
    3592           0 :         if (isPointerType(mapping_variable_type)) {
    3593           0 :             mapping_variable_expression = buildVarRefExp(var_sym);
    3594             :         }
    3595             :         else {
    3596           0 :             mapping_variable_expression = buildAddressOfOp(buildVarRefExp(var_sym));
    3597           0 :         };
    3598           0 :         map_variable_list->append_expression(mapping_variable_expression);
    3599           0 :         map_variable_base_list->append_expression(mapping_variable_expression);

    3848           0 : ASTtools::VarSymSet_t transUpirDataMappingVariables (SgStatement* target_directive, SgExprListExp* map_variable_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_base_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_size_list, SgExprListExp* map_variable_type_list) {
    3849           0 :   ASTtools::VarSymSet_t all_syms;
    3850           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (all_syms.size() == 0); // it should be empty
    3851             : 
    3852           0 :   SgUpirFieldBodyStatement* target = (SgUpirFieldBodyStatement*)target_directive;
    3853           0 :   if (isSgUpirSpmdStatement(target) != NULL) {
    3854           0 :       SgNode* parent = target->get_parent();
    3855           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(parent != NULL);
    3856           0 :       if (isSgBasicBlock(parent)) { //skip the possible block in between
    3857           0 :           parent = parent->get_parent();
    3858             :       }
    3859           0 :       target = isSgUpirTaskStatement(parent);
    3860             :   }
    3861           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (target != NULL);
    3862             : 
    3863             :   // collect map clauses and their variables
    3864             :   // ----------------------------------------------------------
    3865             :   // Some notes for the relevant AST input:
    3866             :   // we store a map clause for each variant/operator (alloc, to, from, and tofrom), so there should be up to 4 SgOmpMapClause.
    3867             :   //    SgOmpClause::omp_map_operator_enum
    3868             :   // each map clause has
    3869             :   //   a variable list (SgVarRefExp), accessible through get_variables()
    3870             :   //   a pointer to array_dimensions, accessible through get_array_dimensions(). the array_dimensions is identical among all map clause of a same "omp target"
    3871             :   //     std::map<SgSymbol*,  std::vector < std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > >  array_dimensions
    3872             : 
    3873           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> data_fields;
    3874           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> device_clauses;
    3875           0 :   data_fields = getClause(target, V_SgUpirDataField);
    3876           0 :   device_clauses = getClause(target, V_SgOmpDeviceClause);
    3877             : 
    3878           0 :   if ( data_fields.size() == 0) return all_syms; // stop if no map clauses at all
    3879             : 
    3880             :   // store each time of map clause explicitly
    3881           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_alloc_clause = NULL;
    3882           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_to_clause = NULL;
    3883           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_from_clause = NULL;
    3884           0 :   SgOmpMapClause* map_tofrom_clause = NULL;
    3885             :   // dimension map is the same for all the map clauses under the same omp target directive
    3886           0 :   std::map<SgSymbol*,  std::vector < std::pair <SgExpression*, SgExpression*> > >  array_dimensions;
    3887           0 :   std::map<SgSymbol*, std::vector< std::pair< SgOmpClause::omp_map_dist_data_enum, SgExpression * > > > dist_data_policies; // no in use, for compatible reason
    3888             : 
    3889             :   // a map between original symbol and its device version : used for variable replacement
    3890           0 :   std::map <SgVariableSymbol*, SgVariableSymbol*>  cpu_gpu_var_map;
    3891             : 
    3892             :   // store all variables showing up in any of the map clauses
    3893           0 :   SgInitializedNamePtrList all_mapped_vars;
    3894           0 :   std::set<SgSymbol*> array_syms; // store clause variable symbols which are array types (explicit or as a pointer)
    3895           0 :   std::set<SgSymbol*> atom_syms; // store clause variable symbols which are non-aggregate types: scalar, pointer, etc
    3896           0 :   for (size_t i = 0; i < data_fields.size(); i++) {
    3897           0 :     std::list<SgUpirDataItemField*> data_items = ((SgUpirDataField*)data_fields[i])->get_data();

    3902           0 :         SgInitializedName* mapping_variable = variable_symbol->get_declaration();
    3903           0 :         all_mapped_vars.push_back(mapping_variable);
    3904             : 
    3905           0 :         std::list<std::list<SgExpression*>> sections = data_item->get_section();
    3906           0 :         if (sections.size() > 0) {
    3907           0 :             array_syms.insert(variable_symbol);
    3908             :             // TODO: assume the array is always 1D for now
    3909             :             // generate array dimensions that ROSE/REX can use
    3910           0 :             std::list<std::list<SgExpression*>>::iterator sections_iterator = sections.begin();
    3911           0 :             std::list<SgExpression*> array_section = *sections_iterator;
    3912           0 :             std::list<SgExpression*>::iterator array_section_iterator = array_section.begin();
    3913           0 :             SgExpression* lower_bound = *array_section_iterator;
    3914           0 :             array_section_iterator++;
    3915           0 :             SgExpression* length = *array_section_iterator;
    3916           0 :             std::pair<SgExpression*, SgExpression*> array_dimension = {lower_bound, length};
    3917           0 :             std::vector<std::pair<SgExpression*, SgExpression*>> array_dimension_list = {array_dimension};
    3918           0 :             array_dimensions[variable_symbol] = array_dimension_list;
    3919             :         }
    3920             :         else {
    3921           0 :             atom_syms.insert(variable_symbol);
    3922             :         }
    3923             :     }
    3924             :   }
    3925             : 
    3926             :   // store all variables showing up in any of the device clauses
    3927           0 :   SgExpression* device_expression = NULL;

    3929             :

    3933           0 :   if (isSgUpirTaskStatement(target)) {
    3934           0 :       insertion_scope = isSgBasicBlock(target->get_scope());
    3935             :       insertion_anchor_stmt = target;
    3936             :   }
    3937             :   else {
    3938           0 :       SgBasicBlock* body_block = ensureBasicBlockAsBodyOfOmpBodyStmt(target);
    3939           0 :       insertion_scope = body_block;
    3940           0 :       insertion_anchor_stmt = (body_block->get_statements())[0];
    3941             :   }
    3942           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(insertion_scope != NULL);
    3943           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(insertion_anchor_stmt != NULL);
    3944             :

    3946           0 :   std::map <SgVariableSymbol *, bool> variable_map = collectVariableAppearance (insertion_scope);
    3947             : 
    3948           0 :   if (device_expression == NULL) {
    3949           0 :     device_expression = buildIntVal(0);

    3951             :

    3955           0 :   std::vector<SgExpression* >* mapping_array_type_list = new std::vector<SgExpression* >();
    3956             :   // handle array variables showing up in the map clauses:
    3957           0 :   for (std::set<SgSymbol*>::const_iterator iter = array_syms.begin(); iter != array_syms.end(); iter ++)
    3958             :   {
    3959           0 :     SgSymbol* sym = *iter;
    3960           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (sym != NULL);
    3961           0 :     SgType* orig_type = sym->get_type();
    3962             : 
    3963             :     // Step 1: declare a pointer type to array variables in map clauses, we linearize all arrays to be a 1-D pointer
    3964             :     //   Element_type * _dev_var;
    3965             :     //   e.g.: double* _dev_array;
    3966             :     // I believe that all array variables need allocations on GPUs, regardless their map operations (alloc, to, from, or tofrom)
    3967             : 
    3968             :     // TODO: is this a safe assumption here??
    3969           0 :     SgType* element_type = orig_type->findBaseType(); // recursively strip away non-base type to get the bottom type
    3970           0 :     string orig_name = (sym->get_name()).getString();
    3971           0 :     string dev_var_name = "_dev_"+ orig_name;
    3972             : 
    3973           0 :     SgVariableDeclaration* dev_var_decl = NULL;

    4009             :   // if either from or tofrom:
    4010             :   // two possible solutions:
    4011             :   // 1) we need to treat it as an array of size 1 or any other choices. TODO!!

    4749           0 : void transOmpTargetLoopBlock(SgNode* node)

    4766             : 
    4767             :   // Step 1. Loop normalization
    4768             :   // For the init statement: for (int i=0;... ) becomes int i; for (i=0;..)
    4769             :   // For test expression: i<x is normalized to i<= (x-1) and i>x is normalized to i>= (x+1)
    4770             :   // For increment expression: i++ is normalized to i+=1 and i-- is normalized to i+=-1 i-=s is normalized to i+= -s
    4771           0 :   SageInterface::forLoopNormalization(for_loop);

    4988             :

    4996           0 :                     case SgOmpClause::e_upir_data_mapping_to:
    4997           0 :                         variable_mapping_type_enum = variable_mapping_type_enum | OMP_TGT_MAPTYPE_TO;
    4998           0 :                         break;
    4999           0 :                     case SgOmpClause::e_upir_data_mapping_from:

    5307             : 
    5308             :   /*
    5309             :    * Expected AST layout:
    5310             :    *  SgOmpSectionsStatement
    5311             :    *    SgBasicBlock
    5312             :    *      SgOmpSectionStatement (1 or more section statements here)
    5313             :    *        SgBasicBlock
    5314             :    *          SgStatement
    5315             :    *
    5316             :    * Example translated code:
    5317             :       int _section_1 = XOMP_sections_init_next (3);
    5318             :       while (_section_1 >=0) // This while loop is a must
    5319             :       {
    5320             :         switch (_section_1) {
    5321             :           case 0:
    5322             :             printf("hello from section 1\n");
    5323             :             break;
    5324             :           case 1:
    5325             :             printf("hello from section 2\n");
    5326             :             break;
    5327             :           case 2:
    5328             :             printf("hello from section 3\n");
    5329             :             break;
    5330             :           default:
    5331             :             printf("fatal error: XOMP_sections_?_next() returns illegal value %d\n", _section_1);
    5332             :             abort();
    5333             :         }
    5334             :         _section_1 = XOMP_sections_next ();  // next round for the current thread: deal with possible number of threads < number of sections
    5335             :      }
    5336             : 
    5337             :       XOMP_sections_end();   // Or  XOMP_sections_end_nowait ();
    5338             :    * */
    5339           0 :   void transOmpSections(SgNode* node)
    5340             :   {
    5341             : //    cout<<"Entering transOmpSections() ..."<<endl;
    5342           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL );
    5343             :     // verify the AST is expected
    5344           0 :     SgOmpSectionsStatement * target = isSgOmpSectionsStatement(node);
    5345           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(target != NULL );
    5346           0 :     SgScopeStatement * scope = target->get_scope();
    5347           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(scope != NULL );
    5348           0 :     SgStatement * body = target->get_body();

    5701             :   //! Add __thread for each threadprivate variable's declaration statement and remove the #pragma omp threadprivate(...)
    5702           0 :   void transOmpThreadprivate(SgNode * node)
    5703             :   {
    5704           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(node != NULL );
    5705           0 :     SgOmpThreadprivateStatement* target = isSgOmpThreadprivateStatement(node);
    5706           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(target != NULL );
    5707             : 
    5708           0 :     SgVarRefExpPtrList nameList = target->get_variables ();
    5709           0 :     for (size_t i = 0; i<nameList.size(); i++)
    5710             :     {
    5711           0 :       SgInitializedName* init_name = nameList[i]->get_symbol()->get_declaration();
    5712           0 :       ROSE_ASSERT(init_name != NULL);
    5713           0 :       SgVariableDeclaration*  decl = isSgVariableDeclaration(init_name-> get_declaration());

    5718             :      // init_name-> get_storageModifier ().set_thread_local_storage (true);

    5720             : 
    5721             :     // 6/8/2010, handling #if attached to #pragma omp threadprivate
    5722           0 :     SgStatement* n_stmt = SageInterface::getNextStatement(target);
    5723           0 :     if (n_stmt == NULL)
    5724             :     {
    5725           0 :       cerr<<"Warning: found an omp threadprivate directive without a following statement."<<endl;
    5726           0 :       cerr<<"Warning: the attached preprocessing information to the directive may get lost during translation!"<<endl;
    5727             :     }
    5728             :     else
    5729             :     {
    5730             :       // preserve preprocessing information attached to the pragma,
    5731             :       // by moving it to the beginning of the preprocessing info list of the next statement .
    5732           0 :       movePreprocessingInfo(target, n_stmt, PreprocessingInfo::before, PreprocessingInfo::before, true);
    5733             :     }
    5734             : 
    5735           0 :     removeStatement(target);
    5736           0 :   }

    5959             :    //! Return a reduction variable's reduction operation type

    5986             :      // Must have a hit
    5987           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT(found == true);

    5990             : 
    5991             :    //! Create an initial value according to reduction operator type
    5992           0 :    SgExpression* createInitialValueExp(SgOmpClause::omp_reduction_identifier_enum r_operator)
    5993             :    {
    5994           0 :      SgExpression * result = NULL;
    5995           0 :      switch (r_operator )
    5996             :      {
    5997             :        // 0: + - ! ^ ||  ior ieor
    5998           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_plus:
    5999           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_minus:
    6000           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_bitor:
    6001           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_bitxor:
    6002           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_or:
    6003           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_ior:
    6004           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_ieor:
    6005           0 :           result = buildIntVal(0);
    6006           0 :           break;
    6007             :        // 1: * &&
    6008           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_mul:
    6009           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_bitand:
    6010           0 :           result = buildIntVal(1);
    6011           0 :           break;
    6012             :         // TODO
    6013           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_logand:
    6014           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_logor:

    6016           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_eqv:
    6017           0 :        case SgOmpClause::e_omp_reduction_neqv:

    6031             : 
    6032             :   //! Check if a variable is in a variable list of a given clause type
    6033           0 :   bool isInClauseVariableList(SgInitializedName* var, SgUpirFieldBodyStatement * clause_stmt, const VariantT& vt)
    6034             :   {
    6035           0 :     return isInClauseVariableList(var, clause_stmt, VariantVector(vt));
    6036             :   }
    6037             : 
    6038             :  // lastprivate can be used with loop constructs or sections.
    6039             :    /* if (i is the last iteration)
    6040             :    *   *shared_i_p = local_i
    6041             :    *
    6042             :    * The judge of last iteration is based on the iteration space increment direction and loop stop conditions
    6043             :    * Incremental loops
    6044             :    *      < upper:   last iteration ==> i >= upper
    6045             :    *      <=     :                      i> upper
    6046             :    * Decremental loops
    6047             :    *      > upper:   last iteration ==> i <= upper
    6048             :    *      >=     :                      i < upper
    6049             :    * AST: Orphaned worksharing OmpStatement is SgUpirWorksharingStatement->get_body() is SgForStatement
    6050             :    *
    6051             :    *  We use bottom up traversal, the inner omp for loop has already been translated, so we have to get the original upper bound via parameter
    6052             :    *
    6053             :    *  Another tricky case is that when some threads don't get any iterations to work on, the initial _p_index may still trigger the lastprivate 's
    6054             :    *     if (_p_index>orig_bound) statement
    6055             :    *  We add a condition to test if the thread really worked on at least on iteration before compare the _p_index and the original boundary
    6056             :    *     if (_p_index != p_lower_ && _p_index>orig_bound)
    6057             :    *       statement
    6058             :    *
    6059             :    *  Parameters:
    6060             :    *    ompStmt: the OpenMP statement node with a lastprivate clause
    6061             :    *    end_stmt_list: a list of statement which will be append to the end of bb1. The generated if-stmt will be added to the end of this list
    6062             :    *    bb1: the basic block affected by the lastprivate clause
    6063             :    *    orig_var: the initialized name for the original lastprivate variable. Necessary since transOmpLoop will replace loop index with changed one
    6064             :    *    local_decl: the variable declaration for the local copy of the lastprivate variable
    6065             :    *    orig_loop_upper: the worksharing construct's upper limit:
    6066             :    *       for-loop: the loop upper value,
    6067             :    *       sections: the section count - 1
    6068             :    *
    6069             :    * */
    6070           0 : static void insertOmpLastprivateCopyBackStmts(SgStatement* ompStmt, vector <SgStatement* >& end_stmt_list,  SgBasicBlock* bb1,
    6071             :                               SgInitializedName* orig_var, SgVariableDeclaration* local_decl, SgExpression* orig_loop_upper)
    6072             : {
    6073           0 :   SgStatement* save_stmt = NULL;
    6074           0 :   if (isSgUpirWorksharingStatement(ompStmt))
    6075             :   {
    6076           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (orig_loop_upper != NULL);
    6077           0 :     Rose_STL_Container <SgNode*> loops = NodeQuery::querySubTree (bb1, V_SgForStatement);
    6078           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (loops.size() != 0); // there must be 1 for loop under SgUpirWorksharingStatement
    6079           0 :     SgForStatement* top_loop = isSgForStatement(loops[0]);
    6080           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (top_loop != NULL);
    6081             :     //Get essential loop information
    6082           0 :     SgInitializedName* loop_index;
    6083           0 :     SgExpression* loop_lower, *loop_upper, *loop_step;
    6084           0 :     SgStatement* loop_body;
    6085           0 :     bool  isIncremental;
    6086           0 :     bool isInclusiveBound;
    6087           0 :     bool isCanonical = SageInterface::isCanonicalForLoop (top_loop, &loop_index, & loop_lower, & loop_upper, & loop_step, &loop_body, & isIncremental, & isInclusiveBound);
    6088           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT (isCanonical == true);
    6089           0 :     SgExpression* if_cond= NULL;
    6090           0 :     SgStatement* if_cond_stmt = NULL;
    6091             :     // we need the original upper bound!!
    6092           0 :     if (isIncremental)
    6093             :     {
    6094           0 :       if (isInclusiveBound) // <= --> >
    6095             :       {
    6096           0 :         if_cond= buildGreaterThanOp(buildVarRefExp(loop_index, bb1), copyExpression(orig_loop_upper));
    6097             :       }
    6098             :       else // < --> >=
    6099             :       {
    6100           0 :         if_cond= buildGreaterOrEqualOp(buildVarRefExp(loop_index, bb1), copyExpression(orig_loop_upper));
    6101             :       }
    6102             :     }
    6103             :     else
    6104             :     { // decremental loop
    6105           0 :       if (isInclusiveBound) // >= --> <
    6106             :       {
    6107           0 :         if_cond= buildLessThanOp(buildVarRefExp(loop_index, bb1), copyExpression(orig_loop_upper));
    6108             :       }
    6109             :       else // > --> <=
    6110             :       {
    6111           0 :         if_cond= buildLessOrEqualOp(buildVarRefExp(loop_index, bb1), copyExpression(orig_loop_upper));
    6112             :       }
    6113             :     }
    6114             :     // Add (_p_index != _p_lower) as another condition, making sure the current thread really worked on at least one iteration
    6115             :     // Otherwise some thread which does not run any iteration may have a big initial _p_index and trigger the if statement's condition
    6116           0 :     if_cond_stmt = buildExprStatement(buildAndOp(buildNotEqualOp(buildVarRefExp(loop_index, bb1), copyExpression(loop_lower)), if_cond)) ;

    6118           0 :     save_stmt = buildIfStmt(if_cond_stmt, true_body, NULL);
    6119             :   }

    6159             :   //1. builtin function TODO

    6424             : #endif
    6425             : 
    6426             : //! This is a highly specialized operation which can find the right place to insert a Fortran variable declaration
    6427             : //  during OpenMP lowering.
    6428             : //
    6429             : //  The reasons are:
    6430             : //    1)Fortran (at least F77) requires declaration statements to be consecutive within an enclosing function definition.
    6431             : //    The C99-style generation of 'int loop_index' within a SgBasicBlock in the middle of some executable statement is illegal
    6432             : //     for Fortran. We have to find the enclosing function body, located the declaration sequence, and add the new declaration
    6433             : //     after it.
    6434             : //
    6435             : //    2) When translating OpenMP constructs within a parallel region, the declaration (such as those for private variables of the construct )
    6436             : //       should be inserted into the declaration part of the body of the parallel region, which will become function body of the outlined
    6437             : //       function when translating the region later on.
    6438             : //       Insert the declaration to the current enclosing function definition is not correct.
    6439             : //
    6440             : // Liao 1/12/2011
    6441           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration * buildAndInsertDeclarationForOmp(const std::string &name, SgType *type, SgInitializer *varInit, SgBasicBlock *orig_scope)
    6442             : {
    6443           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (SageInterface::is_Fortran_language() == true);
    6444           0 :   SgVariableDeclaration * result = NULL;
    6445             : 
    6446             :   // find the right scope (target body) to insert the declaration, start from the original scope
    6447             : 
    6448           0 :   SgBasicBlock* t_body = NULL;
    6449             : 
    6450             : #if 0
    6451             :   //find enclosing parallel region's body
    6452             :   SgUpirSpmdStatement * omp_stmt = isSgUpirSpmdStatement(getEnclosingNode<SgUpirSpmdStatement>(orig_scope));
    6453             :   if (omp_stmt)
    6454             :   {
    6455             :     SgBasicBlock * omp_body = isSgBasicBlock(omp_stmt->get_body());
    6456             :     ROSE_ASSERT(omp_body != NULL);
    6457             :     t_body = omp_body;
    6458             :   }
    6459             :   else
    6460             :   {
    6461             :     // Find enclosing function body
    6462             :     SgFunctionDefinition* func_def = getEnclosingProcedure (orig_scope);
    6463             :     ROSE_ASSERT (func_def != NULL);
    6464             :     SgBasicBlock * f_body = func_def->get_body();
    6465             :     ROSE_ASSERT(f_body!= NULL);
    6466             :     t_body = f_body;
    6467             :   }
    6468             :   ROSE_ASSERT (t_body != NULL);
    6469             : #else
    6470           0 :    t_body = getEnclosingRegionOrFuncDefinition(orig_scope);
    6471             : #endif
    6472             :   // Build the required variable declaration
    6473           0 :   result = buildVariableDeclaration (name, type, varInit, t_body);
    6474             : 
    6475             :   // Insert to be the declaration after current declaration sequence, if any
    6476             : #if 0
    6477             :   SgStatement* l_stmt = findLastDeclarationStatement (t_body);
    6478             :   if (l_stmt)
    6479             :     insertStatementAfter(l_stmt,result);
    6480             :   else
    6481             :     prependStatement(result, t_body);
    6482             : #else
    6483           0 :     insertStatementAfterLastDeclaration (result, t_body);
    6484             : #endif
    6485           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT (result != NULL);
    6486           0 :   return result;
    6487             : }
    6488             :     //! Translate clauses with variable lists, such as private, firstprivate, lastprivate, reduction, etc.
    6489             :     //bb1 is the affected code block by the clause.
    6490             :     //Command steps are: insert local declarations for the variables:(all)
    6491             :     //                   initialize the local declaration:(firstprivate, reduction)
    6492             :     //                   variable substitution for the variables:(all)
    6493             :     //                   save local copy back to its global one:(reduction, lastprivate)
    6494             :     // Note that a variable could be both firstprivate and lastprivate
    6495             :     // Parameters:
    6496             :     //     ompStmt: the OpenMP statement node with variable clauses
    6497             :     //     bb1: the translation-generated basic block to implement ompStmt

    6502             :     //    We have no concept of firstprivate or lastprivate

    6557             :       // Sara, 5/31/2013: if variable is in Function Scope ( a parameter ) and array,
    6558             :       // we don't want a private copy, since the only thing private is the pointer, not the pointed data
    6559             :       // We had a variable passed as private that has to be used as shared
    6560             :       // We create a pointer to the variable and replace all the occurrences of the variable by the pointer
    6561             :       // Example:
    6562             :       // source code:
    6563             :       // void outlining( int M[10][10] ) {
    6564             :       //   #pragma omp task firstprivate( M )

    6649             :       // Liao, 2/12/2013. For an omp for loop within "omp target". We translate its reduction variable by using
    6650             :       // a two-level reduction method: thread-block level (within kernel) and beyond-block level (done on CPU side).
    6651             :       // So we have to insert a pointer to the array of per-block reduction results right before its enclosing "omp target" directive
    6652             :       // The insertion point is decided so that the outliner invoked by transOmpTargetParallel() can later catch this newly introduced variable
    6653             :       // and handle it in the parameter list properly.

    6895             :  //! Build a non-reduction variable clause for a given OpenMP directive. It directly returns the clause if the clause already exists
    6896           0 :   SgOmpVariablesClause* buildOmpVariableClause(SgUpirFieldBodyStatement * clause_stmt, const VariantT& vt)
    6897             :   {
    6898           0 :     SgOmpVariablesClause* result = NULL;
    6899           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(clause_stmt != NULL);
    6900           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(vt != V_SgOmpReductionClause);
    6901           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgOmpClause*> clauses = getClause(clause_stmt,vt);
    6902             : 
    6903           0 :     if (clauses.size()==0)
    6904             :     {
    6905           0 :       switch(vt)
    6906             :       {
    6907           0 :         case V_SgOmpCopyinClause:

    7106             : 
    7107             : /*
    7108             :  * Winnie, Handle collapse clause before openmp and openmp accelerator
    7109             :  * add new variables inserted by SageInterface::loopCollasping() into mapin clause
    7110             :  *
    7111             :  * This function passes target for loop of collpase clause and the collapse factor to the function SageInterface::loopCollapse.
    7112             :  * After return from SageInterface::loopCollapse, this function will insert new variables(generated by loopCollapse()) into map to
    7113             :  * or map tofrom clause, if the collapse clause comes with target directive.
    7114             :  *
    7115             :  */
    7116           0 : void transOmpCollapse(SgStatement* node)
    7117             : {
    7118             : 
    7119           0 :   SgUpirLoopParallelStatement* target = isSgUpirLoopParallelStatement(node);

    7125           0 :   SgForStatement * for_loop = isSgForStatement(body);

    7128           0 :     return;

    7146             :    *   target_stmt, #pragma omp target
    7147             :    *                or, #pragma omp parallel, when is not OmpTarget

    7149             :    *   outside this if condition, ompacc=false means, no need to add new variables in the map in clause

    7151             :    *         we have to move the corresponding variable declarations to be in front of the directive containing map().
    7152             :    */

    7209             : 
    7210             : //! Bottom-up processing AST tree to translate all OpenMP constructs
    7211             : // the major interface of omp_lowering
    7212             : // We now operation on scoped OpenMP regions and blocks
    7213             : //    SgBasicBlock
    7214             : //      /                   #
    7215             : //     /                    #
    7216             : // SgUpirSpmdStatement   #

    7221             : //                \         #
    7222             : //                SgUpirSpmdStatement
    7223           0 : void lower_omp(SgSourceFile* file)
    7224             : {
    7225           0 :   ROSE_ASSERT(file != NULL);
    7226             : 
    7227             :   // Liao 12/2/2010, Fortran does not require function prototypes
    7228           0 :   if (!SageInterface::is_Fortran_language() )

    7235             :

    7237             : 
    7238           0 :   Rose_STL_Container<SgNode*> upir_nodes;

    7240           0 :     upir_nodes.clear();

    7255           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(upir_node != NULL);

    7266             :

    7268           0 :     bool isVariant = isSgOmpWhenClause(node->get_parent()) || isSgOmpDefaultClause(node->get_parent());

    7270             :     {
    7271           0 :       std::cout << "It is a variant.\n";
    7272             :       //continue;
    7273             :     } //else
    7274             : 
    7275             :     /*Winnie, handle Collapse clause.*/
    7276           0 :     if(hasClause(node, V_SgOmpCollapseClause))

    7279           0 :     if (!isVariant)
    7280           0 :     switch (node->variantT())

    7282           0 :       case V_SgUpirSpmdStatement:
    7283           0 :         {
    7284             :           // check if this parallel region is under "omp target"
    7285           0 :           SgNode* parent = node->get_parent();

    7288           0 :             parent= parent->get_parent();

    7291             :           else
    7292           0 :             transOmpParallel(node);

    7295           0 :       case V_SgOmpSectionsStatement:
    7296           0 :         {
    7297           0 :           transOmpSections(node);
    7298             :           break;
    7299             :         }
    7300             : 
    7301           0 :       case V_SgOmpTaskStatement:
    7302           0 :         {
    7303           0 :           transOmpTask(node);
    7304             :           break;
    7305             :         }
    7306           0 :       case V_SgUpirLoopParallelStatement:
    7307           0 :       case V_SgOmpDoStatement:
    7308           0 :         {
    7309             :           // check if the loop is part of the combined "omp parallel for" under the "omp target" directive
    7310             :           // TODO: more robust handling of this logic, not just fixed AST form
    7311           0 :           bool is_target_loop = false;
    7312           0 :           SgNode* parent = node->get_parent();
    7313           0 :           ROSE_ASSERT (parent != NULL);
    7314             :           // skip a possible BB between omp parallel and omp for, especially when the omp parallel has multiple omp for loops
    7315           0 :           if (isSgBasicBlock(parent))
    7316           0 :             parent = parent->get_parent();
    7317           0 :           SgNode* grand_parent = parent->get_parent();
    7318           0 :           if (isSgBasicBlock(grand_parent))
    7319           0 :             grand_parent = grand_parent->get_parent();
    7320           0 :           ROSE_ASSERT (grand_parent != NULL);
    7321             : 
    7322           0 :           if (isSgUpirSpmdStatement (parent) && isSgUpirTaskStatement(grand_parent) )
    7323           0 :             is_target_loop = true;
    7324             : 
    7325           0 :           if (is_target_loop)
    7326             :           {
    7327             :             //            transOmpTargetLoop (node);

    7435             : 
    7436             : // global_tid is required as a parameter in many kmpc function calls
    7437             : // we always use the function "__kmpc_global_thread_num" to get the global_tid.
    7438             : // each OpenMP statement has such an id with unique name "__global_tid_<enclosing function name>_<original statement line number>_<tid index>"
    7439           0 : static SgVariableDeclaration* get_kmpc_global_tid(SgNode* target, SgScopeStatement* scope) {
    7440             : 
    7441           0 :     const Sg_File_Info* info = target->get_startOfConstruct();
    7442           0 :     SgFunctionDeclaration * enclosing_function = getEnclosingFunctionDeclaration(target);
    7443           0 :     std::string enclosing_function_name = enclosing_function->get_name().getString();
    7444           0 :     std::stringstream statement_line_number;
    7445           0 :     statement_line_number << info->get_line();
    7446           0 :     std::stringstream kmpc_global_tid_number;
    7447           0 :     kmpc_global_tid_number << kmpc_global_tid_counter;
    7448           0 :     kmpc_global_tid_counter += 1;
    7449           0 :     std::string kmpc_tid_name = "__global_tid_" + enclosing_function_name + "_" + statement_line_number.str() + "_" + kmpc_global_tid_number.str();
    7450           0 :     SgExprStatement* global_tid_statement = buildFunctionCallStmt("__kmpc_global_thread_num", buildIntType(), buildExprListExp(buildIntVal(0)), scope);
    7451           0 :     SgExpression* get_thread_global_tid = global_tid_statement->get_expression();

    7453             : 
    7454           0 :     return kmpc_tid_declaration;
    7455             : }

    7457             : // insert a parameter to the outlined function

    7488           0 : static SgFunctionDeclaration* move_outlined_function(SgFunctionDeclaration* outlined_func, SgSourceFile* new_file) {

    7517           0 : static SgSourceFile* generate_outlined_function_file(SgFunctionDeclaration* outlined_func, std::string file_extension) {

    7519             :     // prepare the required information of original file

    7527           0 :     };

    7549             :

    7552             : 
    7553           0 : static void fix_storage_modifier(SgSourceFile* new_file) {
    7554             :     // set the regular global variables in the new file to extern and remove their definition
    7555           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgNode*> global_variable_list = NodeQuery::querySubTree(new_file, V_SgVariableDeclaration);
    7556           0 :     Rose_STL_Container<SgNode*>::iterator global_variable_list_iterator;
    7557           0 :     for (global_variable_list_iterator = global_variable_list.begin(); global_variable_list_iterator != global_variable_list.end(); global_variable_list_iterator++) {
    7558           0 :         SgVariableDeclaration* global_variable = isSgVariableDeclaration(*global_variable_list_iterator);
    7559           0 :         if (isSgGlobal(global_variable->get_scope())) {
    7560           0 :             SgStorageModifier& variable_modifier = global_variable->get_declarationModifier().get_storageModifier();
    7561           0 :             if (!variable_modifier.isStatic()) {
    7562           0 :                 variable_modifier.setExtern();
    7563           0 :                 global_variable->reset_initializer(NULL);
    7564             :             };
    7565           0 :         };
    7566           0 :     };
    7567           0 : };
    7568             : 
    7569           0 : static void post_processing(SgSourceFile* file) {
    7570             : 
    7571           0 :     SgGlobal* g_scope = file->get_globalScope();
    7572           0 :     ROSE_ASSERT(g_scope != NULL);
    7573             : 
    7574           0 :     SgSourceFile* new_file = NULL;
    7575             : 
    7576             : 
    7577             :     // handle the outlined functions for NVIDIA GPU
    7578           0 :     if (target_outlined_function_list->size() > 0) {
    7579             :         // create a new file
    7580           0 :         new_file = generate_outlined_function_file(target_outlined_function_list->at(0), "cu");
    7581           0 :         SgGlobal* new_scope = new_file->get_globalScope();
    7582           0 :         SgFile* cur_file = getEnclosingNode<SgFile>(target_outlined_function_list->at(0));
    7583           0 :         std::string file_extension = StringUtility::fileNameSuffix(cur_file->get_file_info()->get_filenameString());
    7584             : 
    7585           0 :         if (file_extension == "c" || file_extension == "C") {
    7586           0 :             PreprocessingInfo* c_linkage_start = new PreprocessingInfo(PreprocessingInfo::ClinkageSpecificationStart, "#ifdef __cplusplus\nextern \"C\" {\n#endif", "Transformation generated", 0, 0, 0, PreprocessingInfo::after);
    7587           0 :             SageInterface::insertHeader(new_scope->lastStatement(), c_linkage_start, 1);
    7588           0 :         };
    7589             : 
    7590             :         // move the outlined functions
    7591           0 :         std::vector<SgFunctionDeclaration* >::reverse_iterator i;
    7592           0 :         for (i = target_outlined_function_list->rbegin(); i != target_outlined_function_list->rend(); i++) {

    7594             :             // the naming pattern is "<kernel name>_exec_mode"
    7595           0 :             SgVariableDeclaration* kernel_exec_mode_decl = buildVariableDeclaration ((*i)->get_name().getString() + "_exec_mode", buildCharType(), buildAssignInitializer(buildIntVal(0)), new_scope);

    7597           0 :             kernel_exec_mode_modifier.setCudaGlobal();
    7598           0 :             appendStatement(kernel_exec_mode_decl, new_scope);
    7599             : 
    7600           0 :             move_outlined_function(*i, new_file);
    7601           0 :         };

    7603           0 :         if (file_extension == "c" || file_extension == "C") {
    7604           0 :             PreprocessingInfo* c_linkage_end = new PreprocessingInfo(PreprocessingInfo::ClinkageSpecificationEnd, "#ifdef __cplusplus\n}\n#endif", "Transformation generated", 0, 0, 0, PreprocessingInfo::after);
    7605           0 :             SageInterface::insertHeader(new_scope->lastStatement(), c_linkage_end, 1);
    7606           0 :         };
    7607           0 :     };
    7608             : 
    7609           0 :     SageInterface::insertHeader("rex_kmp.h", PreprocessingInfo::before, false, g_scope);
    7610           0 :     if (new_file != NULL) {
    7611           0 :         AstPostProcessing(new_file);
    7612           0 :     };

    7614           0 : };
